longDescription.Effect: +0.7 Tears up.
longDescription.Trivia:
The Sad Onion was the first item designed by Edmund for the original game The Binding of Isaac, which is probably why it has the item ID 1.
The item's effect is a reference to the fact that when onions are cut, they have a tendency to make people involuntarily cry.

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac fires a spread of three tears at once.
Tears down: (Delay * 2.1) + 3
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20: Overidden by The Inner Eye.
  20/20 : Shoots 5 tears instead of 3.
Azazel: Fires three short ranged brimstone beams that overlap. Significant increase in tear delay.
 The Forgotten: Triples bones thrown and swung. Significant increase in tear delay.
 Keeper: Fires 6 tears with significantly increased tear delay.
Kidney Stone: Increase number of tears in tear barrage; however, only fires one stone.
Loki's Horns: Only occasionally fires one tear in the other three directions.
Mom's Eye: Only occasionally fires one tear out of the back of Isaac's head.
Monstro's Lung: Adds tears to barrage with a significant increase in tear delay.
Mutant Spider: Overrides The Inner Eye.
  Mutant Spider : Shoots 7 tears instead of 3. No further decrease in fire rate.
The Wiz: Fires two sets of three tears diagonally outwards.

longDescription.Effect: Grants homing tears.
longDescription.Interactions:
Anti-Gravity: Tears will fly towards enemies that come too close, chasing them until they either hit the enemy or fall to the ground. If the enemy is killed tears fly around like The Peeper until they hit the ground.
The Ludovico Technique: The tear will attempt to home towards a single target, even if it hits a different enemy on its way there, making it difficult to control.
My Reflection: Tears will home in on enemies if close; otherwise, they will return to Isaac.
Technology Zero: Tears will home in on enemies but the electricity won't.
longDescription.Trivia:
Spoon Bender is a reference to the common stage magic trick of spoon bending.
  Possibly a reference to The Matrix .
This item is used in Challenge #16 (Computer Savvy).
The Brimstone + Spoon Bender synergy was modeled after the Plasma Laser, first introduced in Raiden II, according to Tyrone's tweet.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.5 damage up.
x1.5 damage multiplier.
longDescription.Notes: The x1.5 damage multiplier does not stack with the x1.5 damage multiplier from Magic Mushroom, from the combination of The Book of Belial and Blood of the Martyr, or itself (by using an item such as Diplopia, for example). However, it will stack with any other multipliers, such as Sacred Heart.
longDescription.Trivia:
In the original Binding Of Isaac, this item was known as "Max's Head". Max was the name of a dog that Ed McMillen wanted as a child but never got.
  The filename for the item icon in the game files still refers to it as "Max's Head".
Cricket's Head is named after one of Ed's former cats that is now rehomed, Cricket.
The shocked look on Isaac's face implies that like with many children, his pet's death was kept secret from him.
Although Cricket's Body and Cricket's Head are presumed to be from the same animal, Cricket's Body has darker fur color and spots than Cricket's Head.

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac's tears travel a short distance, then reverse direction and return to Isaac.
  The tears are constantly pulled towards Isaac; if Isaac moves after shooting, the tears will always return to him.
+1.5 range
+0.6 shot speed
+1 shot height
longDescription.Interactions:
Anti-Gravity: The tears will slowly move towards Isaac instead of remaining stationary. Releasing the fire button will launch the tears as usual.
Brimstone: Overrides My Reflection.
  Makes the beam curve when moving. Has the same effect on Azazel's mini-brimstone and doubles the range.
Continuum: If tears cross the border of the room, they will move towards Isaac from their new position rather than crossing back across the border.
Compound Fracture/The Parasite/Cricket's Body: Split tears will move towards Isaac.
Dr. Fetus: Not recommended. The bombs will slide back towards Isaac after having reached a certain distance.
Epic Fetus: Overrides My Reflection.
Euthanasia: Needles from Euthanasia bursts will move towards Isaac.
Flat Stone: Tears bounce away from and then back towards Isaac.
Haemolacria: Range becomes extremely high, making Haemolacria tears follow Isaac for a long time before hitting the ground. Burst tears do not have the boomerang effect.
Ipecac: Not recommended. The explosive tears will begin flying back towards Isaac after having reached a certain distance.
Lachryphagy: Tears will move towards Isaac and can still be fed and burst. Burst tears will also move towards Isaac.
A Lump of Coal: The tears increase in damage as they are pulled towards Isaac.
The Ludovico Technique: The tear will slowly move towards Isaac, and the shot speed increase allows the tear to be moved much faster.
Mom's Knife: No effect, as the knife already has this effect.
Piercing Tears: Despite the piercing effect, tears cannot damage the same enemy multiple times.
Pop!: Tears can still bounce off of each other but will try to return to Isaac.
Proptosis: At base tear size, tears disappear before they can return to Isaac.
Rubber Cement: Isaac's tears will continually be pulled towards him, effectively reducing the chances that tears will bounce.
Spoon Bender: If tears are close enough to an enemy, it will home in and damage them. If not, they will return to Isaac.
Strange Attractor: Not recommended. While it may make it easier to hit enemies, it also makes it much easier for them to be attracted towards Isaac, surrounding him.
Technology: Overrides My Reflection.
  Makes the beam curve when moving.
Technology 2/ Tech.5: Tears return to character and the beams curve when moving.
Tech X: Stat effects of My Reflection remain but the boomerang effect does not.
Tiny Planet: The orbital tears will move faster to stay in orbit around Isaac, making aiming easier.
Trisagion: Makes the beams much longer as they move away from and then back towards Isaac.
Whip Worm: Further increases shot speed, making Isaac's tears travel much farther forward before returning to Isaac.
longDescription.Trivia:
Isaac's appearance may be a reference to the anime Sailor Moon. The main character (Sailor Moon) has a crescent on her forehead and a secondary character (Sailor Neptune) uses a mirror as a source for her powers.
The item's sprite and effect may be a reference to the urban myth that if someone breaks a mirror, they will have bad luck for 7 years - Isaac's bad luck comes in the form of having his tears return to him.
This item is used in Challenges #7 (Suicide King) and #15 (Slow Roll).

longDescription.Effect:
+1.5 tears.
-17.62 range.
+0.76 tear height.
Tears turn yellow and are fired from Isaac's lower body rather than his head.
longDescription.Interactions:
Azazel: Lowers range, reduces charge time.
Compound Fracture/ The Parasite: Tears often disappear before being able to split. Split tears also only travel a very short distance.
Cricket's Body: Tears disappear very quickly after being fired and split tears barely travel at all.
Dr. Fetus: Not recommended. Bombs do not travel far, making self damage very likely.
Haemolacria: Does not affect main tear; however, burst tears travel significantly less far.
Kidney Stone: Tear barrage fires a very short distance before disappearing. Does not affect the stone.
A Lump of Coal: Tears still increase in size and damage as they travel; however, the short range limits tear size and damage.
Marked: Tears become orange. Firing rate is increased, Marked's effect is unaffected but range is reduced.
Mom's Knife: The knife turns yellow and the maximum range is significantly reduced.
Monstro's Lung/Lead Pencil: Not recommended. Tear barrage disappears very close to Isaac.
Proptosis: Not recommended. Tears disappear after traveling a very short distance.
Rubber Cement: Tears often disappear before being able to bounce off walls.
Toothpicks: Tears become orange.
longDescription.Trivia:
"Number One" is a euphemism for urination.
In the original Binding of Isaac, Number One had the effect of turning all future Range Down pills into Range Up pills. This was presumably designed to reduce the risk of players being stuck in situations where their range would become too low to clear certain rooms. However, in Rebirth, Number One no longer has this effect, and will not turn Range Down pills into Range Up pills.
This item is used in Challenge #2 (High Brow).
 The firing animation of Number One is a little different from what it looks like in the original Binding of Isaac.

longDescription.Effect: Increases damage by 1, and turns Isaac's tears into blood tears.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is a reference to the book of Revelations: And I saw the woman drunken with the blood of the saints, and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus: and when I saw her, I wondered with great admiration. -Revelation 17:6
This item's appearance is a reference to the crown of thorns placed upon Jesus Christ's head during his crucifixion.

longDescription.Effect:
This item causes many Fly enemies to move slower and alter their behavior toward Isaac.
  The following flies transform into a neutral Black Fly : Attack Fly , Dart Fly , Eternal Fly , and Ring Fly . 
  The following flies retain their form and deal contact damage: Large Attack Fly , Swarm Fly , Hush Fly , Boom Fly , Red Boom Fly , Drowned Boom Fly , Sucker , and Spit . 
  The following flies retain their form and do not deal contact damage: Moter , Level 2 Fly , Full Fly , Pooter , and Super Pooter .
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.Notes:
This item can only be obtained from the Shell Game Beggar in the arcade.
Flies spawned by The Husk will not become passive.
longDescription.Trivia:
Skatole is a mildly toxic white crystalline organic compound that occurs naturally in feces.
Skatole was considered as a cosmetic hat for Team Fortress 2, alongside tears, Brimstone, and Tiny Planet. It was dropped as Valve "... didn't want players running around with a wet piece of poop on their head."

longDescription.Effect:
Grants one red heart container.
+0.3 Damage Up.
x1.5 Damage Multiplier.
+5.25 Range Up.
+0.3 Speed Up.
+0.5 Tear Height.
Isaac grows in size.
Fully restores all red heart containers.
 This item belongs to the Fun Guy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking mushroom.
 This item belongs to the Stompy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Stompy.
longDescription.Notes:
The Magic Mushroom does not give a tears up or luck up despite its quote saying 'All Stats Up!'.
The x1.5 damage multiplier does not stack with the x1.5 damage multiplier from Cricket's Head, from the combination of The Book of Belial and Blood of the Martyr, or itself (by using an item such as Diplopia, for example). However, it will stack with any multipliers not listed here.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item and its size change effect is a reference to the mushroom species, Amanita muscaria (fly agaric), which causes visual and auditory hallucinations, including perceived changes in size.
'Magic mushrooms' is a colloquial term for psilocybin mushrooms, although the mushroom itself contains no psilocybin or psilocin.
This item and its effects are also a reference to the Super Mushroom from the Super Mario series of video games.
This item is one of only two in the game that works towards 2 transformations (Stompy and Fun Guy). The other one is The Bible.
This item shares a retro pickup sound with 1up!.

longDescription.Effect:
Inflicts poison on enemies who make contact with Isaac.
  The poison randomly hits either 2 or 3 times, dealing a total of 4 or 6 damage.
   Each poison hit deals damage equal to Isaac's tear damage. 
  Enemies who are killed after they have been inflicted with this type of poison have a 20% chance to drop black hearts .
-0.1 Speed down ( not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated)
 This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.
longDescription.Notes:
The black heart is only dropped if the poison was caused by The Virus. The item's effect doesn't extend to poison tears.
 Black flies are the best source of black hearts, since they can't deal any damage, which means that you can poison them without losing health.
  You can abuse this if you find a Skatole item and a Hive enemy. This will result in an infinite source of black hearts. 
  Although Stonies and Shopkeepers can't be visibly poisoned, they still can drop Black Hearts if destroyed after being touched.
Due to a glitch or patch, some enemies must be moving to receive poison damage. Some enemies pushing against Isaac that are immobile will not take damage, while the poisoned effect will still show up.
  Gnawed Leaf and The Virus can still work if Isaac has a short range orbital such as Cube of Meat or Ball of Bandages , as it will kill enemies pushing against Isaac that are not taking poison damage due to immobility while still dropping black hearts.
longDescription.Trivia: Upon picking up The Virus, Isaac looks very similar to Lust, which is fitting since Lust also drops The Virus.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.6 Speed up.
+5.25 Range up.
+0.5 Shot Height.
 This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.
longDescription.Trivia: Roid Rage describes the frequent anger outbursts induced by the overuse of steroids.

longDescription.Effect: Grants Isaac one red heart container and fully restores Isaac's health.
longDescription.Trivia: "<3" is the ASCII/Emoticon version of a heart.

longDescription.Effect: Gives Isaac two red heart containers and fully restores Isaac's health.
longDescription.Notes:
Gives Blue Baby and The Soul 2 Soul Hearts.
Gives The Forgotten 2 Bone Hearts.
No effect on Keeper.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #10 (Cursed!).

longDescription.Effect: Gives the player 99 keys.
longDescription.Notes:
Rerolling this item with the D4, D100, Missing No., or a 1 or 6 pip Dice Room will not remove the 99 keys.
This item is very useful for donating to Key Masters.
longDescription.Trivia: A skeleton key is a type of master key which can be used to open most types of locks, usually warded locks.

longDescription.Effect: Upon picking up A Dollar, the player's coin count will be set to 99, the maximum possible amount of money.
longDescription.Notes:
Picking this item up will automatically unlock Cain.
Multiple Dollars can be dropped in the same run by different slot machines.

longDescription.Effect: Grants 10 bombs.
longDescription.Notes: Effectively a weaker version of Pyro, which grants 99 bombs instead of 10.

longDescription.Effect: Grants flight.
longDescription.Trivia:
The pickup quote "We all float down here... " is a reference to the Stephen King book 'IT'.
If Scissors are used after picking up Transcendence, Isaac will have no body from which to shoot tears. Only a shadow and orbitals will remain.
This item is used in Challenge #6 (Solar System).
In the original Binding Of Isaac, Transcendence was unlocked by beating Mom's Heart two times instead of three.

longDescription.Effect:
Reveals all special rooms on the map, excluding secret rooms and super secret rooms.
The following rooms will be revealed if they exist:
  Boss Room 
  Mini-Boss Room 
  Treasure Room 
  Shop 
  Arcade 
  Challenge Room 
  Boss Challenge Room 
  Curse Room 
  Sacrifice Room 
  Library 
  Vault 
  Dice Room 
  / Bedrooms
longDescription.Notes: The Compass will reveal if Greed is present by displaying a mini-boss icon with the shop icon. It might also reveal if Greed is present in the Secret Room, and thus, the location of the Secret Room itself.
longDescription.Trivia:
The compass icon is the same from the first Legend of Zelda game.
This item is used in Challenge #10 (Cursed!).

longDescription.Effect: Grants one full red heart container.
longDescription.Trivia: In the original Binding Of Isaac, the dog bowl had the name "Max" carved on it. This is a reference to a dog that Edmund McMillen wanted as a child but never got. Edmund McMillen had wanted to name the dog Max.

longDescription.Effect: Grants one full red heart container.
Grants Isaac one full red heart container.
Grants Isaac one full red heart container.
longDescription.Notes: If an item pool runs out of items, it will only contain Breakfast from that point onwards.
longDescription.Trivia: The term used by the community when an item pool is depleted is "breakfasting."

longDescription.Effect: Grants a full heart container.
+0.3 Speed
+0.3 Speed

+5.25 Range.
+0.5 Shot Height.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.

+5.25 Range.
+0.5 Shot Height.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.

+5.25 Range.
+0.5 Shot Height.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
+0.7 Tears up.
longDescription.Trivia:
In the original flash version of The Binding of Isaac, this item was unlocked by default.
This item is likely a reference to the usage of wire coat hangers to perform abortions.

longDescription.Effect:
+1 Luck.
Increases chances of winning at Shell Game Beggar and Fortune Teller (independent of the luck stat).
Increases chances of getting a room clearing drop (independent of the luck stat).
longDescription.Notes: Cain starts with this item by default.
longDescription.Interactions: Lucky Toe: The extra luck-independent chance of room clearing drops from both Lucky Toe and Lucky Foot applies only in a diminished form, unless at zero or negative luck.
longDescription.Trivia:
In the original Binding of Isaac, Lucky Foot also had the added effect of changing "bad pills" into "good pills". This does not apply in Rebirth, Afterbirth, or Afterbirth+.
On the Character Select Screen, this item is mistakenly called the "Luck Foot".
The lucky foot may be a reference to rabbit's foot, which is carried as an amulet for good luck.

longDescription.Effect: Grants piercing tears that travel through enemies (but not obstacles) instead of breaking on impact with them.
longDescription.Interactions:
8 Inch Nails/Blister/Cricket's Head/Flat Worm: Reduces knockback effectiveness of these items.
Dr. Fetus: Bombs travel through enemies. When combined with Ipecac, bombs do not explode upon hitting enemies.
Fire Mind: Tears will continue to pierce enemies while retaining the explosion chance.
Ipecac: Pierces through poop and fireplace, but not enemies.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenge #15 (Slow Roll) and Challenge #35 (Pong).
The item name is a reference to Valentine's Day and Cupid shooting an arrow into people's hearts to make them fall in love with someone.
Despite its name, it does not charm enemies.

Steven appeared in the original The Binding of Isaac.
Steven originated from the 2009 flash game Time Fcuk, which was created by Edmund McMillen.
 Steven can appear in Greed Mode prior to his prerequisites being completed.
As they appear in Time Fcuk and on the boss art, Big and Small Steven have the back of their heads attached to each other. However, their attachment does not appear this way ingame. This is likely due to Big and Small Steven having the same function of how Contusion and Suture are conjoined, only without the long cord holding them together.
According to Edmund McMillen, Steven is Isaac's future self.[1]
Steven appears in The End is Nigh, another game created by Edmund McMillen.
One of the images that can appear before the start of a run states "GET IN THE BOX", which is Steven's unofficial catchphrase from Time Fcuk.
  It is also likely an allusion to both Time Fcuk and The Binding Of Isaac taking place inside some form of box.

longDescription.Effect:
+1 Damage.
Increases chance for a Devil / Angel Room Door to open when a floor Boss is killed by 10%.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #4 (Darkness Falls).

longDescription.Effect:
Tears are replaced with bombs that explode approximately one second after being fired.
  Each bomb deals 3 times the character's normal tear damage. 
  Each bomb deals 5 times the character's normal tear damage plus a flat 30 damage. The flat 30 is not affected by damage multipliers.
longDescription.Notes:
Dr. Fetus overrides multiple tear effect items but benefit from some (but not all) bomb-enhancing effects like Mr. Mega.
  In Afterbirth, many more synergies have been added.
With Dr. Fetus, the range and shot speed stats both affect the velocity at which the bombs are fired out. Delay before explosion is not affected by either.
Dr. Fetus is one of the items that directly affect tear delay.
longDescription.Interactions:
A Lump of Coal: No damage increase.
Anti-Gravity: Overriden by Dr. Fetus. Stat effects are still applied.
Brimstone: Overrides Brimstone.
  : Isaac continuously fires bombs while charging the blood laser. Overrides Azazel's blood laser.
Chocolate Milk: Bombs can't be charged, but reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%.
Cricket's Body: Slight tears up and greatly reduced range, but bombs do not split.
  : Upon exploding, bombs split into four small bombs that are not affected by Isaac's bomb modifiers.
Compound Fracture: No effect beyond slight range increase, bombs do not split.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Dr. Fetus.
 The Forgotten: A live bomb will spawn on top of The Forgotten when he starts charging his attack. The Forgotten will toss bombs after releasing the charge, airborne bombs deal 1.5x his damage if they collide with an enemy with enough speed. Max distance is obtained with minimal charge. If the bomb explodes while charging, a normal ranged bone attack happens after releasing. The melee attack is unaffected.
Guppy: Dr. Fetus Bombs exploding do not spawn flies.
Kidney Stone: Not recommended. Due to Kidney Stone's massive range decrease, and due to the tear height stat not affecting Dr. Fetus' bombs, they spawn directly in front of Isaac, making self damage very likely.
Lachryphagy: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.
Lead Pencil: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.
Marked: Overridden by Dr. Fetus. Stat effects are still applied.
Mom's Eye: Grants a chance to shoot an extra bomb from the back of Isaac's head.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Dr. Fetus.
  : Isaac continuously fires bombs while charging the knife. 
  Mom's Knife + Incubus : The Incubus loses the ability to fire bombs.
My Reflection: Not recommended. Bombs lose momentum and slide back towards Isaac, making self damage very likely.
The Parasite: No effect.
  Upon exploding, bombs split into two other bombs, which explode almost immediatly.
Piercing tears/Spectral tears: Using piercing/spectral tears is not recommended as it will make aiming at and killing enemies or destroying obstacles more difficult.
Pop!: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.
 Sad Bombs: Fires tears as normally placed Sad Bombs would.
Technology: Overrides Technology.
  Both bombs and lasers are fired.
Technology Zero: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.
Tiny Planet: Not recommended. Bombs fly uncontrollably around the player, making self damage very likely.
Tough Love: Applies damage and radius bonus. The bomb's appearance remains unchanged.
  Tears that would have fired a tooth shot instead become a bomb with the Mr. Mega effect, dealing more damage and shaking the screen.
Trisagion: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.
longDescription.Trivia:
The Dr. Fetus and Epic Fetus items are based off of Dr. Fetus, the main villain in Super Meat Boy which is a game by Edmund McMillen (the creator of The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth).
This item is used in Challenge #9 (Demo Man).
In the original Binding of Isaac, Dr. Fetus was unlocked by beating Mom's Heart five times instead of nine.

longDescription.Effect:
Pickups (e.g. hearts, coins, keys, bombs, etc.) are attracted to Isaac.
  The attraction enables the item to pass/fly over pits or rocks, but not through Key Blocks. 
  Hearts are only attracted if Isaac could pick them up with his existing heart containers. 
  Batteries act in a similar manner to hearts in that they will only be attracted towards Isaac if his active item isn't fully charged.
A few enemies (like the Horf) are drawn toward Isaac as well.
longDescription.Notes: Magneto can attract scared hearts, but they still run away from Isaac.
longDescription.Trivia:
The item's name may be a reference to the X-Men villain, Magneto.
This item's coloration and placement on Isaac's head may be in reference to Magnet Man, a villain from the early Mega Man games.
Despite what the description says, Magneto will not attract passive or active items.

longDescription.Effect: Causes all rooms, excluding the Secret Room and Super Secret Room, to appear on the minimap. Does not reveal contents of rooms.
longDescription.Notes: When combined with Blue Map and The Compass, the entire floor is revealed, identical to the effect of The Mind.
longDescription.Trivia:
Treasure Map received a significant downgrade in Rebirth, as it no longer reveals Secret Rooms. That effect, along with being able to reveal Super Secret Rooms, now belongs to the Blue Map.
This item is used in Challenge #10 (Cursed!).
Treasure Maps are a common item to find in Legend Of Zelda games.

Mom's_Eye.shortDescription: Eye in the back of your head

longDescription.Effect:
Gives Isaac a chance to shoot a tear out of an eye on the back of his head.
  The chance to shoot a second tear depends on the luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 2 Luck.
longDescription.Notes:
Has no effect on Lilith.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Only occasionally fires one tear out of the back of Isaac's head.
Dr. Fetus: Occasionally shoots a bomb backwards. Not recommended, as self-damage is likely.
Doctor's Remote/Epic Fetus: Chance for two airstrikes on opposite sides of Isaac.
Ipecac: Occasionally shoots an explosive shot backwards. Not recommended, as self-damage is likely.
Incubus: No effect.
Kidney Stone: Adds chance for tear barrage to fire from the front and back of Isaac. The kidney stone will only fire from the front of Isaac.
Lead Pencil: Adds a chance for tear barrage to be fired behind Isaac.
The Ludovico Technique: Adds a chance for tears to be fired in random directions from the main tear.
Monstro's Lung: Occasionally fires one red tear out the back of Isaac's head.
Tractor Beam: The backwards tear is not affected by Mom's Eye.
longDescription.Trivia:
Mom's Eye's appearance was changed in Booster Pack #5.
The item is based off of the old adage that a mother has an eye on the back of her head, and is thus always able to see what her child is up to.

longDescription.Effect: Allows Isaac to walk across gaps one square across by automatically placing a ladder between the two walkable sections. Enemies can not walk over the ladder.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is a reference to the Ladder in The Legend of Zelda for the NES.
 This item is used in Challenge #26 (I RULE!).

longDescription.Effect: Restores half a red heart for every 13 enemies killed.
longDescription.Notes:
As Keeper, health coins can be restored with this item.
As Blue Baby and The Lost, this item has no effect because these characters have no red hearts.
longDescription.Interactions: Maggy's Bow: No effect.
longDescription.Trivia:
If the player clears out a room and saves at least one enemy, they can save, quit, and then continue the run to enter the same room with enemies reset. The counter for Charm of the Vampire is saved along with the game, meaning the player can farm the same room for red hearts.
 This item is used in Challenge #25 (Have a Heart).
A Vampire is a being from folklore who subsists by feeding on the life essence (generally in the form of blood) of the living.
If the player dies while one of their tears is on track to kill an enemy (or by killing a weak enemy using contact damage) Charm of the Vampire can heal the player for half a heart while the player is in the process of dying, leaving the player dead with half a red heart.

longDescription.Effect:
Active items can store an extra level of charge, allowing them to be used twice in one room.
  Extra charges appear in yellow over the normal charge meter.
longDescription.Notes:
The Battery does not affect self-recharging activated items.
  Self-recharging active items can charge the yellow meter, allowing Isaac to use them twice immediately.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in It's in the Cards (challenge #14).
The screws that appear in Isaac's head may be a reference to Frankenstein's Monster.
The effect of this item was completely changed from the original Binding of Isaac.

longDescription.Effect: Halves shop prices.
longDescription.Notes:
Items sold for 15 pennies will have their price rounded down to 7.
Pickups sold for 5 pennies will have their price rounded up to 3. Red hearts, normally sold for 3 pennies, will have their price rounded up to 2.
Multiple Steam Sales can be obtained via each of the normal drop methods, but doing so has no effect.
  Reduces all shop prices to 0 coins.
   If Isaac has Restock , it is possible to collect an infinite supply of pickups/items. Extremely powerful when combined with Chaos . 
  Steam Sale will cause the Deals with the Devil not to convert the heart type automatically.
 Items have a chance to be discounted further by random sales; for example, a discounted item originally costing 5 coins will then cost 2 coins instead of 3.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is called Steamy Sale on the PS Vita and Xbox One versions, most likely due to fear of copyright issues.
  This was also the case on the PS4 and Switch versions, but was later reverted back to Steam Sale in Booster Pack #5.
Steam Sale refers to the platform of Steam and its reputation for giving generous sales.

longDescription.Effect: Replaces tears with a piercing laser with unlimited range, but does not fire over rocks and obstacles.
longDescription.Notes: Laser rate of fire is determined by the tears stat. This differentiates the item from Technology 2 which fires a continuous beam, and Tech.5 which has a random fire rate.
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20: Overridden by Technology.
  Shoot 2 lasers.
Anti-Gravity: Tears up, but no Anti-Gravity effect.
Azazel: Overrides Azazel's Brimstone.
  Technology laser wraps around the Brimstone beam, dealing extra damage, but not increasing Brimstone range.
Blue Cap: Tears up, shot speed decrease is ignored.
Blood Clot: 50% chance to apply the flat damage up with each shot.
Chemical Peel: 50% chance to apply the flat damage up with each shot.
Chocolate Milk: Lasers can't be charged, but reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%.
Continuum: Overridden by Technology.
Cursed Eye: Overridden by Technology.
Cricket's Body: Tear delay down as expected, but no benefit from the splash effect.
Dead Eye: Overridden by Technology.
Death's Touch: Overridden by Technology, but still gain damage.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Technology.
  Fires lasers in addition to bombs.
Euthanasia: The lasers can gain the damage multiplier from Euthanasia although there is no visual difference. Euthanasia loses its instant kill ability, however.
Flat Worm/Pulse Worm/Ring Worm: No effect.
Godhead: Homing laser, but the halo is lost.
Head of the Keeper: Overridden by Technology.
Holy Light: Holy light shots will not activate.
Hook Worm: Laser follows a square wave, which increases its hitbox.
Ipecac: Laser poisons targets.
  : Additionally, gives a flat +4 damage.
Jacob's Ladder: Overridden by Technology.
A Lump of Coal: No effect.
  Damage increases the further away the enemy is, on a multiplier that is roughly +20% per tile of distance. This allows for a huge damage increase from longer distances.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Technology.
  Both fire normally.
   When playing as Lilith , Mom's Knife overrides Technology. 
  Mom's Knife + The Ludovico Technique : The laser ring becomes centered on Isaac and cannot be controlled, and the knife can not be fired. This makes some rooms impossible to do without a familiar .
My Reflection: Overridden by Technology.
  Makes the beam curve the opposite direction while Isaac is moving sideways.
Mysterious Liquid: Overridden by Technology.
  The laser spawns pools of liquid always when it hits obstacles and occasionally on enemies.
Number One: Expected tears up and the laser's color turns yellow.
Ouroboros Worm: No effect on laser besides +4 range.
Pupula Duplex: Laser becomes spectral.
The Parasite: Overridden by Technology.
Parasitoid: Overridden by Technology.
Rubber Cement: Overridden by Technology.
  Lasers bounce off of walls.
Whip Worm: No effect on laser besides +0.5 shot speed.
Wiggle Worm: Laser follows a sine wave, which increases its hitbox.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #16 (Computer Savvy).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants charged tears that deal greater damage when fully charged.
  Tear damage scales from approximately 30% damage at minimum charge to 400% damage at full charge.
Tears down: (Delay * 2.1) + 3
longDescription.Notes: Repeatedly pressing a key to fire allows Isaac to fire as quickly as the key is pressed, up to the equivalent of a maxed tears stat. This is not generally recommended, as overall damage per second is greatly reduced.
longDescription.Interactions:
Anti-Gravity: No effect, but retains the reduced tear delay.
Cursed Eye: The charge bar only indicates the current charge for Chocolate Milk, not for Cursed Eye; the latter's charge is determined by the eye's glow. If charged until Cursed Eye fully glows, Isaac fires one Chocolate Milk shot, followed by up to three minimal power ones.
Marked: Isaac will automatically charge his shots. Fire rate increases when the crosshair is closer to Isaac, and damage increases when the crosshair is farther from Isaac.
Mega Blast: Firing the Mega Blast beam while Chocolate Milk charges preserves the charge, but does not increase the beam's damage.
Soy Milk: Overrides Chocolate Milk, but Isaac gains a flat +1 damage bonus after the Soy Milk damage penalty.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #29 (Onan's Streak).

longDescription.Effect:
+1 Damage
+0.4 Speed
 This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.

+0.3 Speed.
-4.25 Range.
+1.5 Shot Height.
Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit.
 This item belongs to the Fun Guy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking mushroom.
longDescription.Notes: Even if the range stat is decreased, the effective range is slightly increased due to the changes to the hidden shot height attribute.
longDescription.Interactions: Dr. Fetus: Effective range is decreased since shot height does not affect Dr. Fetus.
longDescription.Trivia: This item and its effects are likely a reference to the Mini Mushroom of the Super Mario series.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants 3 Soul Hearts.
Increases the chance to find The Bible. The item has a chance to appear in any Item Pool.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.
longDescription.Notes:
It is possible to find The Bible multiple times in a single run; however, once picked up, it cannot appear again.
This item stacks with the Rosary Bead trinket, further increasing the chance to find The Bible in the Library and Shop.
The approximate chances of finding The Bible in each item pool are:

longDescription.Effect: Gives Isaac 25 coins.
longDescription.Notes: It has a chance to spawn when urns or shopkeepers are destroyed.
longDescription.Trivia:
When the shop item pool is depleted, it is possible to find The Quarter for sale in the store for 15 cents. This can also occur in the I AM ERROR room.
In the original Binding of Isaac, A Quarter was unlocked by beating Mom's Heart four times instead of eight.

longDescription.Effect:
Identifies all pills upon pickup.
Converts some "bad" pills into their "good" counterparts:
  All "stat down" pills into "stat up" pills 
  Bad Trip into Balls of Steel 
  Amnesia into I Can See Forever 
  ??? into Telepills 
  Addicted into Percs! 
  I'm Excited!!! into I'm Drowsy... 
  Paralysis into Pheromones 
  Retro Vision into I can see forever! 
  R U A Wizard? into Power Pill! 
  X-Lax into Something's wrong...
Spawns a pill.
Replenishes 2 red hearts.
Adds 0-2 coins to the payout every time you use the Blood Donation Machine or IV Bag.
longDescription.Notes:
The following pill types are neutral and do not have a "good" equivalent, or are otherwise left unchanged by PHD.
  ??? 
   Converted to Telepills 
  Explosive Diarrhea 
  Hematemesis 
  I Found Pills 
  Infested! 
  Infested? 
  One makes you small 
  One makes you larger 
  Paralysis 
   Converted to Pheromones 
  Pheromones 
  Power Pill! 
  Pretty Fly 
  Puberty 
  R U A Wizard? 
   Converted to Power Pill! 
  Re-Lax 
  Telepills
Bad pills already obtained/dropped will be converted to their "good" counterparts.
If PHD is rerolled by the D4 or a Dice Room, pills will be identified on pickup, but negative pills will not be prevented from spawning.
 Performing a RERUN with a character that held PHD will still prevent negative pills from spawning, but will no longer identify pills until used.
As bad pills will turn into good pills, it is possible for two different colored pills to have the same effect.

longDescription.Effect: Opens Secret Rooms and Super Secret Rooms automatically.
longDescription.Notes: When in The Void, the entrances are not automatically opened or even identified if the room is not yet cleared. Re-entering the room once enemies are killed and/or silver buttons pressed will open the doors normally.
longDescription.Trivia: The flavour text "I've seen everything" could be a reference to Patrick Stewart's popular scene in the TV series "Extras".

longDescription.Effect:
+1 Damage up.
+0.2 Speed up.
Grants one soul heart.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.Trivia:
The Mark refers to the Mark of the Beast in the end of times prophecies (3 6's arranged in a triskelion). Without this mark, one would not be allowed to buy or sell.
While The Mark's icon shows the 6's facing towards the center, on Isaac's forehead the symbol appears with the 6's facing outwards.
Loki has the Mark of the Beast on his forehead.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.5 Damage.
+0.7 Tears.
Grants two Soul Hearts.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.

Grants Flight.
+0.3 Speed Up ( not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated).
longDescription.Trivia:
Lord of the Pit's icon resembles the Cross of St. Peter.
The wings granted by Lord of the Pit are identical to Azazel's wings.
The item is a reference to a 'Magic: The Gathering' card of the same name featuring a black-winged demonic creature on it, which is the appearance Isaac assumes upon picking up the item.
"The Lord of the Gap" is a name commonly given to Belphegor, the demon of sloth and invention.

longDescription.Effect:
Chance to shoot tears four ways like the bosses Loki and Lokii can.
Chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 7 Luck.
longDescription.Notes: As she does not fire any tears herself, picking up this item with Lilith is useless.
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Adds a chance for one tear to be fired in the other three directions.
Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/Euthanasia: Adds a chance for 4 tears to be fired in cardinal directions. Split tears will not be always be fired in cardinal directions.
Dr. Fetus: Not recommended. Adds a chance to fire four bombs in cardinal directions, which are hard to avoid, restrict your movements, and increase chance of self damage.
Ipecac: Adds a chance to fire four explosive shots in cardinal directions. Caution is advised, though it is easier to avoid damage than Dr. Fetus.
Lead Pencil: Will add a chance to fire tear barrage in one of the other cardinal directions.
The Ludovico Technique: Adds a chance for 4 tears to be fired in cardinal directions from the main tear.
Kidney Stone: Will add a chance to fire tear barrage in cardinal directions but will only fire the stone in front of Isaac.
Monstro's Lung: Only one red tear will be fired in the other directions.
Tech X: Overridden by Tech X.
Tractor Beam: Tears fired in the non-main directions are not affected by Tractor Beam.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #11 (Glass Cannon).

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a chance to shoot slowing tears, reducing speed of enemy movement and any projectile fired by them.
 This item belongs to the Spider Baby set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a humanoid spider.
longDescription.Notes:
The slow duration is 2.5 seconds.
The slow effect chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 15 Luck.

longDescription.Effect:
+1 damage up.
-0.2 speed and maximum speed down.
+0.2 tears up.
longDescription.Notes:
It has a small chance to be dropped from a destroyed tinted rock.
 The speed and tears changes will take effect immediately; without it, they will not immediately change until Isaac's speed or tears stats are updated the next time.
The rock normally only appears once per run but can appear again if Isaac's items are re-rolled with the D4, D100, or a Dice Room.
The rock may also appear twice in the same floor if the player does not pick it up the first time encountered, and then bombs another rock to get it again. However, while the Speed down and Tears up stack, the Damage does not.
Taking the rock in the Boss Rush from a tinted rock in the room will count as taking an item and consequently trigger Boss Rush.
longDescription.Trivia:
In the original Binding of Isaac, the player's tears would take on a grey color after Small Rock has been picked up. In Rebirth, however, the tears will be red.
This item is used in Challenge #3 (Head Trauma).

longDescription.Effect:
Reveals on map what type of room all rooms adjacent to your current room are (shop, sacrifice room, etc.)
  This also works for secret rooms and super secret rooms .
longDescription.Notes: Spelunker Hat makes Isaac glow more strongly in the dark (such as when Curse of Darkness is active).
longDescription.Trivia: The item is a reference to the game Spelunky.

longDescription.Effect: Grants one full heart container as well as two soul hearts.
longDescription.Trivia: The item is a reference to Super Meat Boy, one of Edmund McMillen's other games.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants one full red heart container.
+0.3 Damage.
+0.2 Tears.
+0.25 Range.
+0.3 Speed.
+0.5 Tear Height.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.

Adds a chance to shoot poison tears, dealing damage over time when inflicted.
The poison randomly hits either 2 or 3 times, dealing a total of 4 or 6 damage.
  The poison hits twice, dealing a total of double Isaac's damage.
longDescription.Notes:
The chance for a tear to be poisoned depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 12 Luck.
Unlike Scorpio, The Common Cold will only inflict poison status when a poison tear is triggered and is therefore strictly inferior.
longDescription.Interactions: Ipecac/Scorpio: Overrides The Common Cold.

longDescription.Effect:
Tears that deal more than 1.0 damage split into two tears with half damage and half remaining range on impact with obstacles or enemies.
  Damage less than 1.0 causes the tears to simply disappear. 
  The splitting can keep up as long as the tears have range remaining and the damage of the split tears stays above 0.5.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides The Parasite.
Diplopia: No effect.
 Dr. Fetus: Bombs turn orange and with no other effect.
Epic Fetus: Overrides The Parasite.
Ipecac: The Ipecac tear will spawn two smaller explosive tears when it collides with a solid object, but not with an enemy. These tears can spawn tears on their own as well, potentially leading to huge chain reactions. Having Host Hat or Pyromaniac is strongly recommended.
Kidney Stone: Drastically decreases range making it less likely for tears to split. The stone will not split.
Mom's Knife: Knife turns orange with no other effect.
Rubber Cement: Tears only split when hitting enemies and no longer off the wall or most obstacles.
Soy Milk: Without any damage increases, Soy Milk tears deal under 1.0 damage and cannot split until the situation is rectified with other items.
Technology: Overrides The Parasite.
Tech X: Overrides The Parasite.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants 5 bombs.
Gives all of Isaac's bombs increased damage and blast radius.
  Mr. Mega bombs deal 110 damage, while normal bombs deal 60 damage.
When bombs explode, the screen will shake.
longDescription.Notes: It is possible to acquire this item more than once by killing multiple Super Wraths on later floors; however, the bomb damage increase doesn't stack.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenges #7 (Suicide King) and #23 (Blue Bomber).
The cosmetic effect that Mr. Mega gives to Isaac is similar to Wrath.

longDescription.Effect: All damage taken is reduced to half a heart.
longDescription.Notes:
The damage reduction includes every possible source in the game that would cause more than half a heart of damage:
  The player's bombs and other bombs. 
  Champions . 
  Sacrifice Rooms . 
  Environmental hazards such as Spikes . 
  Self-inflicting damage items: Sharp Plug , Blood Rights , Razor Blade , Kamikaze! and Breath of Life . 
  Every source of damage in The Womb / Utero and beyond, including all enemies, curse rooms , blood donation machines , and Devil Beggars . 
  The "HARD HARD" special seed .
The Wafer does not prevent death (even if the player has more than half a heart) by using the Suicide King card, or using the Bible on the Satan boss fight.
  It also cannot prevent health loss from Devil Room deals or Health Down pills .
Despite The Wafer reducing damage to 1/2 a heart, this does not change the amount of invincibility frames the player would normally get from full/two heart damage sources.
It will not work with Keeper as he cannot have half of a health coin.
longDescription.Trivia:
In the original Binding of Isaac, "resistance" in the pickup quote was misspelt as "resistence". This was corrected in Rebirth.
A wafer is a thin cake made of flour, and is used in Christianity for various purposes, including the sacrament of the Eucharist, in which believers consume the body (represented by sacramental bread) and blood (represented by sacramental wine) of Jesus Christ.
In the original Binding of Isaac, The Wafer required an unlock, by beating Mom's Heart seven times.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds 0.04 points of damage for every coin Isaac has.
  The damage caps at +3.96 Damage at 99 coins. 
  Though Isaac can still collect coins if he already has 99, he will not gain any damage bonus from them.
longDescription.Trivia:
The name of the item is a reference to the popular saying "Money is power".
 This item is used in Challenge #24 (PAY TO PLAY).
In the game's files, there's a subliminal message under Money = Power's icon that says "where are you".
  The message was part of an alternate reality game and could be seen on the collection page for a few weeks, representing Isaac asking for his father.
In the original Binding Of Isaac, Money = Power required an unlock, by beating Mom's Heart eight times.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a chance to shoot petrifying tears, which stop enemies in place and prevent them from moving or attacking.
+0.25 Range up ( not applied until the next time Isaac's range stat is updated).
+0.5 Tear Height ( not applied until the next time Isaac's tear height is updated).
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.Notes:
The activation chance depends on the luck stat, and goes up to around 50% with approximately 20 luck.
Petrifying a Heart also freezes the Mask bound to it.
Petrifying an enemy with a weak zone (Scolex or Carrion Queen) will make the enemy take damage anywhere while it is petrified, making combat significantly easier.
longDescription.Interactions:
Epic Fetus: Occasionally fires missiles that can freeze enemies. No visual difference.
Lead Pencil/Monstro's Lung: Increases chances of freezing tears; however, it can be hard to distinguish between normal tears and freezing tears.
Kidney Stone: Increases chances of firing freezing tears; however, it can be hard to distinguish between normal and freezing tears. The stone also has a chance to freeze enemies.
Technology: Lasers can occasionally freeze enemies with no visual difference.
Technology Zero: Electricity connecting tears has its own chance to freeze enemies.
longDescription.Trivia: Mom's Contacts' appearance was changed in Booster Pack #5.

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac's tears are replaced by a knife that pierces enemies and can travel through obstacles. Holding down the fire button increases its range and power.
  The knife can hurt enemies while Isaac is holding it. 
  The knife deals 2x Isaac's damage while held and 6x damage at the furthest possible point of its arc, regardless of the actual maximum range stat.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.Notes:
The knife can be held and fired diagonally. Firing the knife diagonally requires a frame perfect input. However, this can be done easily with a controller's analog stick or with Analog Stick.
The knife will not work in challenges with the Blindfolded effect.
longDescription.Interactions:
Anti-Gravity: Only tear delay down applies.
Apple! / Euthanasia / Tough Love: No chance of higher damage or instant kills.
Chocolate Milk: Doesn't increase damage, but reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%.
Compound Fracture / Cricket's Body / The Parasite: Only stat effects, if any, apply without splitting.
Cursed Eye: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
Dr. Fetus: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
  Both the knife and the bombs fire normally.
Epic Fetus: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
  Each explosion shoots 10 knives in a circle from the point of impact.
Explosivo: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
Eye of Belial: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
Holy Light: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
  Holy Light can trigger on both held and thrown knives.
Lachryphagy: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
Little Horn: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
A Lump of Coal: No effect on the knife regardless of range.
Marked: Only tears up and range up apply.
Monstro's Lung: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
  Firing a knife causes several other knives to shoot out at random directions.
My Reflection: No effect.
Mysterious Liquid: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
  The Knife leaves creep trails while fired.
Pop!: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
Proptosis: Damage is doubled and no damage decrease with distance.
Rubber Cement: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
Technology: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
  Both the knife and the laser fire normally.
Tiny Planet: Knives go in a spiral around Isaac; the longer the knife is charged, the bigger the spiral. Not recommended, as this makes Mom's Knife almost impossible to aim.
Trisagion: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenge #26 (I RULE!).
In the original Binding of Isaac, buying the item from the Devil Room cost 1 heart container instead of 2.
The description of the item is a possible reference to the sniper's dialogue in Team Fortress 2.

longDescription.Effect: Grants spectral tears that travel through obstacles (but not enemies) instead of breaking on impact with them.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Aesthetic only, no effect.
  Azazel : Only cosmetic effect.
Dr. Fetus: Bombs will become transparent and pass through objects, just like spectral tears do.
Epic Fetus: No effect.
 The Lost: Useless, as The Lost starts with spectral tears by default.
Mom's Knife: The knife becomes transparent but otherwise, Ouija Board has no effect.
longDescription.Trivia:
A Ouija Board is a flat board marked with the letters of the alphabet, the numbers 09, the words "yes", "no", "hello" (occasionally), and "goodbye", along with various symbols and graphics. It's believed to be a "spirit communicator" allowing you to talk with spirits.
Isaac's expression seems to be from the film "The Ring", after a victim has been killed after 7 days.

longDescription.Effect:
Fully charges the current activated item upon first pickup.
If the current activated item has a recharge time of more than 1 bar, then it will grant 1 bar of charge whenever the item is activated.
If the current activated item has a recharge time of 1 bar, then it will change the item to have a timed recharge of 15 seconds. The recharging of the item only triggers so long as there are enemies present in the room in any fashion. Empty rooms do not cause recharging to start.
  An enemy spawned in a cleared room will also cause recharging to start.
If the current activated item has a real-world unit-based recharge time, the effect of the 9 Volt may vary.
longDescription.Notes: Enemies generated through a slot machine, shell game beggar, or breaking pots/skull will restart the charging process, even though a cleared room still counts as cleared if enemies are spawned in it.
longDescription.Interactions: Sharp Plug: Renders the Sharp Plug unusable. Sharp Plug can only be used if the item is at 0 charge, but 9 Volt instantly gives +1 charge to the item upon activation.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in When Life Gives You Lemons (challenge #12), Beans! (challenge #13), and It's in the Cards (challenge #14).

longDescription.Effect: Taking damage summons a familiar that chases enemies for the remainder of the current room, dealing 2 damage per tick or 4 damage per second.
longDescription.Notes: Eve starts with this item by default.
longDescription.Interactions:
Box of Friends: Does not double Dead Bird, even if Isaac has taken damage before use.
Holy Mantle: Dead Bird will not be activated if damage is taken while Holy Mantle is active.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenge #4 (Darkness Falls).
This item is a reference to an old series of comics Edmund McMillen drew called Thicker Than Water, where the Dead Bird is said to represent his inner doubts and self-destructive nature.

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac's tears are replaced with a charged blood laser beam. The beam is piercing and spectral, dealing damage to all enemies and ignoring all obstacles in its path.
  The laser deals damage equal to Isaac's damage each tick, and ticks a total of 13 times. 
  Tears down: Delay * 3.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.Notes:
Azazel starts the game with a short-ranged, slower charging version of Brimstone. Picking up Brimstone with him will give him the long ranged version. Without the long ranged version, his mini-brimstone won't have enough length to use any homing items. His mini-brimstone's range can be increased with range up items or pills.
If multiple Brimstones are picked up (via Diplopia, Crooked Penny or on a victory lap), then another beam is added, with no increase in charge time.
  Although extremely unlikely, a total of 16 blood beams can be on screen at a time (including beams shot with tear-increasing items, such as 20/20 ). If another Brimstone is picked up, the beams' span will widen.
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20: Overridden by Brimstone.
  Shoots two Brimstone lasers simultaneously without increasing charge time.
8 Inch Nails: Brimstone pushes enemies away in the direction the beam is travelling, but not out of the path of the beam.
Chocolate Milk: Doesn't increase damage, but reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%. Beam is colored brown.
Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body: Overridden by Brimstone. Stat effects are still applied.
Continuum: Overridden by Brimstone.
Cursed Eye: Overridden by Brimstone.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Brimstone.
  Isaac shoots bombs while charging Brimstone.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Brimstone.
  After the missile hits the ground, it spawns 10 Brimstone beams similar to the effect given by Sad Bombs. Azazel's mini-brimstone does not give the Sad Bombs effect.
Evil Eye: Overridden by Brimstone.
Fire Mind: Beam inflicts burning, but cannot cause explosions or leave fires on the ground.
Flat Stone: Overridden by Brimstone.
Flat Worm: No effect.
 The Forgotten: The charged attack will spawn a Brimstone ball which will float in front of The Forgotten for a few seconds before disappearing. The Forgotten will still melee attack while performing this action.
Holy Light: Overridden by Brimstone.
Hook Worm: Beam changes angles while firing straight. Effectively increases the width of the beam.
Ipecac: The character gains neither the increased damage nor the decreased tears of Ipecac. They only gain the poison effect.
  Isaac shoots Ipecac tears while charging Brimstone. Both Brimstone and Ipecac shots modify Isaac's damage and tear delay stat, meaning that Ipecac fires slower and Brimstone charges slower, but Brimstone deals significantly increased damage. The beam is colored yellowish green. Take care to pre-charge Brimstone so that the Ipecac shot is on cooldown as Isaac enters a room.
Isaac's Tears: Fires normal tears, but nearly instantly charges when charging Brimstone.
Jacob's Ladder: Overridden by Brimstone.
Kidney Stone: Overridden by Brimstone.
Lachryphagy: Overridden by Brimstone.
Lead Pencil: Overridden by Brimstone.
A Lump of Coal: Changes the beam's color to black. However, it does not have an effect on damage.
  Beam will gradually increase in size but rapidly increase damage the farther it travels, on a multiplier that is roughly +20% per tile of distance. This allows for a huge damage increase from longer distances.
Marked: Overridden by Brimstone.
Monstro's Lung: Overridden by Brimstone.
  Fires 3-5 additional Brimstone lasers in random directions around Isaac. Does not increase charge time. Charging a new Brimstone laser removes the original from in front of the player, but not the additional ones added by Monstro's Lung. This effectively increases fire rate.
My Reflection: Overridden by Brimstone.
  Makes the beam curve when moving. Has the same effect on Azazel's mini-brimstone but doubles the range.
Mysterious Liquid: Overridden by Brimstone.
  When Brimstone hits enemies or walls it leaves creep based on how long it hits.
The Parasite: Overridden by Brimstone.
Pop!: Overridden by Brimstone.
Pupula Duplex: Overridden by Brimstone.
Rubber Cement: Lasers ricochet off walls.
  If Azael's mini Brimstone beam ricochets, it effectively becomes a full-length Brimstone beam.
Soy Milk: Greatly reduces Brimstone charge time and damage.
Technology: Overridden by Brimstone.
  Brimstone beams become surrounded with swiveling Technology laser beams, granting a 1.5x damage multiplier (it stacks with other similar multipliers like Cricket's Head or Magic Mushroom .
Technology Zero: Overridden by Brimstone.
Technology 2: Overridden by Brimstone, but retains the reduced damage.
  Laser fires while Brimstone is charging.
Tech.5: Overridden by Brimstone unless using Azazel, in which case it will fire with his Brimstone beam.
  Tech.5 fires normally fire charging Brimstone.
Trisagion: Overridden by Brimstone.
longDescription.Trivia:
The term brimstone (burn stone) comes from the King James Bible in reference to burning sulfur. It is used in the phrase "fire and brimstone" to describe the torments of hell.
Brimstone's item icon originally comes from the alchemical symbol for sulfur, referred to as the Leviathan Cross. It was later adopted by Anton LaVey in The Satanic Bible to represent hell, and is now often associated with Satanism.
The ram horns gained from picking up Brimstone were added as a cosmetic item to Team Fortress 2 to promote The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth. If the game was purchased before the 10th of December, players were awarded the item in genuine quality.

longDescription.Effect:
Gives the player a full red heart container and restores 5 red hearts.
+0.3 speed up.
longDescription.Notes: This item can be found and picked up multiple times when generated by a Blood Donation Machine.
longDescription.Trivia: The Blood Bag seems to give Isaac a face similar to Larry Jr.

longDescription.Effect:
+1.7 Tears.
+0.3 Speed.
Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit.
Reduces damage using the following formula: (Damage Ups from other items * 0.9) - 0.4.
 This item belongs to the Fun Guy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking mushroom.
longDescription.Notes:
There are two collectible items in the game named Odd Mushroom; you can tell them apart from the sprites.
This item affects damage differently than other items in the game. Instead of multiplying your damage stat, it directly alters the total added damage from other items. In practice, this means this item reduces your damage significantly if you have no items that grant extra damage (x0.72), but won't have as strong of an impact as you collect more 'damage up' items.

longDescription.Effect:
Gives Isaac one red heart container.
+0.3 Damage.
+0.25 Range.
+0.5 Shot Height.
-0.1 Speed.
Increases Isaac's size.
 This item belongs to the Fun Guy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking mushroom.
longDescription.Notes: There are two collectible items in the game named Odd Mushroom; you can tell them apart from the sprites.

longDescription.Effect:
Increases damage by 1.5 and speed by 0.3 while Isaac has half of a red heart or less.
On Eve, the item has the following extra effects:
  The item is activated at one red heart or less. 
  Her damage multiplier increases from 0.75 to 1.0 when active.
longDescription.Notes:
The effect is removed after leaving a room with more than half a heart (one full heart for Eve).
The effect may be not be immediately applied if Isaac has lost red hearts without taking damage; the effect will activate upon entering a new room.
The effect is always active for characters without red heart containers such as ??? and The Lost, though other characters can also lose their heart containers through devil deals or items like Guppy's Paw, Abaddon, or Health Down pill.
III - The Empress grants a similar effect to Whore of Babylon for the current room which does stack with Whore of Babylon.
  Stacking The Empress on Whore of Babylon either via multiple cards or multiple activations of Blank Card increases damage by number of uses squared , e.g. +1.5 * 2 * 2 total damage bonus for using the card on top of activated Whore of Babylon.
Upon obtaining the Whore of Babylon effect, a popup displaying the text "What a horrible night to have a curse" appears on-screen. This can be disabled in the game options.
 As Keeper cannot have half of a health coin, this item has no effect on him.
 As the Forgotten, the effect will be applied at one half full bone heart.
longDescription.Trivia:
The text that appears when this item is activated is a reference to Castlevania II: Simon's Quest; in the game, the text appears when the sun goes down.
The Whore of Babylon is an evil creature mentioned in the Book of Revelation.
This item is used in Challenge #4 (Darkness Falls).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants 5 bombs.
Bombs slowly home in on enemies.
longDescription.Notes: This item can make bombing out of rooms difficult, as the bombs may slide towards enemies and away from the door.
longDescription.Interactions: Doctor's Remote/Epic Fetus: Crosshair will not home in on enemies.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is a reference to Bob-ombs, enemies from the Mario franchise who self-detonate to hurt Mario.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds 2 empty red heart containers.
-0.2 speed and maximum speed.
Heals half a red heart.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #5 (The Tank).

longDescription.Effect: Tears gain a flat damage bonus based on how far they travel. This starts at +0 and increases to about +6 at a standard room's width (but can go higher).
longDescription.Notes: The item has somewhat of an opposite effect of the item Proptosis, which makes Isaac deal more damage at close range. Proptosis is based on a shrinking multiplier instead of an increasing flat bonus, however.
longDescription.Interactions:
Anti-Gravity: Despite the tears visually growing while they hover, they will still only deal bonus damage based strictly on how far they travel. If the enemy hits the tears by running into them, Coal will add no damage.
  Tears no longer grow while hovering.
Athame: Damage of the Athame ring is halved.
  The ring deals normal damage.
Brimstone: +2 Flat Damage
  Beam will gradually increase in size and damage the farther it travels, on a multiplier that is roughly +20% per tile of distance. 
  Brimstone + The Ludovico Technique : Makes the Brimstone circle widen and deal damage based on how far away it is from your character. At very close ranges, damage is reduced to about 73% (unlike normal Coal effects).
Diplopia: No benefit from an additional Lump.
Dr. Fetus: No benefit though the bombs appear darker.
Epic Fetus: No benefit.
Lachryphagy: Tears will grow until they burst, though their actual damage bonus is only based on distance traveled. Burst tears will also grow as they travel.
Maw of the Void: Damage of the Maw ring is halved.
  The ring deals normal damage.
Mom's Knife: No benefit.
Ouroboros Worm / Ring Worm: The peculiar movement patterns result in overall less damage from the same effective distance.
Proptosis: Proptosis scales with Isaac's damage while the Coal does not. At base damage, tears will have approximately the same damage at any range; with increased damage, tears do more damage up close.
Technology: No benefit.
  Damage increases the further away the enemy is, on a multiplier that is roughly +20% per tile of distance.
Technology 2: No benefit.
  Damage increases the further away the enemy is, on a multiplier that is roughly +20% per tile of distance.
Tech X: The laser ring will grow as the ring distances itself from the player, but will shrink as the player approaches it. Damage increases the further away the enemy is.
Trisagion: The damage of the blasts is increased by a negligible amount.
Wiggle Worm: No relevant additional benefit.
longDescription.Trivia:
In Western culture, children are commonly told that if they behave badly during the year, they will receive a piece of coal for Christmas.
  This makes A Lump of Coal a fitting item for Krampus to drop, based on his origins .

longDescription.Effect:
Grants a 1/3 chance of replacing a pickup with a normal chest or gold chest, but also a 1/3 chance to replace it with nothing at all.
This item belongs to the Guppy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Guppy.
longDescription.Notes: Due to any found chests containing Items while in The Chest or The Dark Room, Guppy's Tail can be a good way to quickly stack up more upgrades before facing the final boss.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #8 (Cat Got Your Tongue).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants one full heart container.
+0.3 damage.
longDescription.Trivia: "Stigmata" is a term used by Catholic priests to designate wounds, sores, etc. found at the same locations on the body as those Jesus sustained during his crucifixion (e.g. palms, feet).

longDescription.Effect:
Allows two different trinkets to be carried at once.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.Interactions: Belly Button: No effect; Isaac can still only hold two trinkets.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants 5 bombs.
Grants all of Isaac's bombs a poison effect.
 This item belongs to the Bob set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Bob.

Spawns seven random coins around Isaac.
  These coins may be any normal type with the usual chances: pennies, nickels, dimes lucky pennies or sticky nickels.

Once per room, when Isaac is reduced to his last half Heart (either red, soul, or black), the aura around his head temporarily vanishes and he is granted one Soul Heart.
  After re-entering a room, the ability can be triggered again.
longDescription.Notes:
If the scapular is activated and you're already at your last half heart, the scapular won't trigger, even if you take fatal damage.
Using a Blood Donation Machine will trigger Scapular once you reach one half heart. Leaving the room afterwards and then re-entering resets Scapular, allowing you to donate blood further using Soul Hearts. Repeating this process after every Scapular activation will allow you to farm coins from the Blood Donation Machine until it breaks.
  This can also be done with a Devil Beggar to eventually get an item from its pool .
Scapular allows you to freely farm Sacrifice Rooms. If performing a sacrifice reduces you to half a heart, Scapular triggers and Isaac will gain a soul heart. Just exit and re-enter the Sacrifice Room and perform another sacrifice. You will lose a soul heart and then immediately regain it. Repeat as necessary.
 Scapular does not charge between waves in Greed Mode, though it can still be recharged by moving between rooms.
Does not work with The Lost or Keeper, as they cannot reach the required heart value.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.3 Speed up.
+0.2 Shot speed up.
 This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.
longDescription.Trivia: A "speedball" is cocaine or an amphetamine mixed with heroin or morphine.

longDescription.Effect:
1-3 blue flies randomly spawn whenever Isaac takes damage.
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.Interactions:
Fish Tail: Doubles number of flies spawned.
Hive Mind: Flies are bigger and deal double damage.

longDescription.Effect:
Replaces tears with explosive and poisoning projectiles fired in an arc.
Tears down - (Delay * 2) + 10
+13 Shot Height
+40 flat damage (See Effective Damage)
 This item belongs to the Bob set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Bob.
longDescription.Notes:
As Ipecac's explosion range does not scale with tear size, with enough tear size increasing items (e.g. Death's Touch), it can become nearly impossible to hit enemies with Ipecac's explosions.
Only enemies directly hit by the Ipecac tear will be applied poisoning; the resulting explosion won't apply poisoning to enemies hit by it.
Ipecac's flat damage upgrade does not increase tear size like standard damage upgrades.
Ipecac's damage bonus does not apply to Burn or Poison fully; only +4 is applied to their damage per tick.
Character damage multipliers do not apply to Ipecac's flat bonus.
Using Ipecac in a Crawl Space will cause the tear to bounce off the ceiling, bounce off the floor at a low height, and eventually explode. The same applies with using it on a Crawl Space wall.
longDescription.Interactions:
Bloody Lust / Crown of Light / Polyphemus / Proptosis / Sacred Heart: The damage multipliers from these items do not apply to Ipecac's +40 bonus, resulting in much lower damage increase than expected.
Brimstone: Blood beam now does poison damage. The character doesn't gain the Damage Up or Tears Down effects.
  Isaac shoots Ipecac tears while charging Brimstone. Both Brimstone and Ipecac shots modify Isaac's damage and tear delay stat, meaning that Ipecac fires slower and Brimstone charges slower, but Brimstone does an extra 40*13 damage. Take care to pre-charge Brimstone so that the Ipecac shot is on cooldown as Isaac enters a room. This interaction also applies to Azazel's mini Brimstone.
Cricket's Body: Main tear splits into four explosive splash tears. The splash tears can still damage Isaac.
Death's Touch: Although damage is increased, the tears' hitbox also grows larger which may be detrimental.
Flat Stone: The Ipecac shots cause full-damage explosions instead of lesser splash damage when they bounce off the floor, though they can also harm Isaac.
The Forgotten: The ghost form uses Ipecac as normal. The skeleton form's melee attacks become poisonous and explosive with +4 flat damage; he cannot be hurt by the blasts, but is pushed back by them. The charged boomerang attack is only poisonous.
Ghost Pepper: If a fire is generated at the same time as a Ipecac shot, the Ipecac shot will explode instantly.
Guppy Transformation: Blue flies are no longer spawned on hit.
  Ipecac shots now spawn blue flies on hit, both direct and indirect.
Little Horn: If an Ipecac shot also happens to have the Little Horn effect, after destroying an enemy it loses its explosive property and effectively is just a normal Little Horn tear.
Lost Contact: Ipecac shots will explode on contact with enemy shots.
The Ludovico Technique: Tear damage is increased by 4, explodes when killing an enemy, and comes back to Isaac.
  +4 damage bonus, no explosion.
Mom's Eye / Loki's Horns: Occasionally shoots backwards or in all 4 directions, with high risk of self-damage.
The Parasite: The Ipecac tear will spawn two smaller explosive tears when it collides with a solid object, but not with an enemy. These tears can spawn tears on their own as well, potentially leading to huge chain reactions.
Piercing tears: Tears will still explode on enemy contact, nullifying piercing.
Rubber Cement: Tears will bounce off walls and rocks and won't explode until they hit the ground. Not recommended, as self damage is likely.
Soy Milk: Though fire rate is greatly increased, the 20% damage multiplier applies resulting in weak explosions.
Spectral tears: Ipecac shots no longer explode on contact with obstacles or walls, making accidental self-damage less likely but it's more difficult to open secret doors.
Tech X: The laser ring becomes poisonous and gains +4 damage.
Technology: Overridden by Technology.
  +4 damage bonus, poisonous laser.
Technology 2: The +40 damage bonus is not affected by the Technology 2 multiplier making the laser very high powered, but only every other Ipecac shot is actually fired.
Technology Zero: High fire rate needed for explosive shots to be connected.
Tiny Planet: Ipecac tears orbit around Isaac for a very long time. They land far enough to not cause self-damage, but that can be relied on only if Isaac is not moving and do not hit enemies.
longDescription.Trivia:
"Ipecac" is a shortened name for syrup of ipecac, a powerful emetic (substance used to induce vomiting). This name is itself derived from a shortening of the source plant's name, Ipecacuanha.
This item is used in Challenge #7 (Suicide King).

longDescription.Effect: Adds a chance to shoot a tooth instead of a tear, which deals greater damage (x3.2) than regular tears.
longDescription.Notes: The chance to fire a tooth depends on the luck stat. At base luck (0), the chance is 10%. It goes up to 100% at 9 luck (around 10% more chance per luck up).
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overridden by Brimstone.
  Occasionally fires Brimstone beam with damage multiplier of Tough Love.
Fire Mind: Adds flaming effect to the teeth, but without the chance of exploding.
Mom's Knife: Overridden by Mom's Knife.

longDescription.Effect:
Tears have a 1/6 chance of spawning allied blue flies when they hit an enemy.
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.Notes:
Because the Guppy transformation includes the guaranteed ability to spawn flies on hit, the Mulligan's effect is nullified. This means individual tears cannot spawn more than one fly per hit.
This item does not work for Lilith since the Incubus tears do not count for her own tears.
Items and trinkets that increase tear firing rate synergize well with the Mulligan.
This item is not affected by Luck.
longDescription.Interactions:
Azazel: His brimstone spawns flies like regular tears.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides The Mulligan.
Epic Fetus: Overrides The Mulligan.
Mom's Knife: Flies only have a chance to spawn if the knife is stationary.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #18 (The Host).

longDescription.Effect:
Replaces the character's right eye tears with an unlimited range piercing laser which fires continuously.
x0.65 Damage multiplier.
The laser deals 20% of Isaac's damage per tick, compounding with the damage down.
longDescription.Notes:
Tear delay is effectively doubled, as Isaac will do a bit of the animation to fire a right eye tear, but no tear will come out.
Charged shots are not affected by the effective tear delay down, as they don't use the alternative left eye/right eye fire scheme.
As Cain can only fire tears from his right eye, Technology 2 will replace his tears altogether, unless he has Technology or a charged attack.
Because Lilith is blindfolded and relies on herIncubus, the only effect gained from Technology 2 is the damage down.
Unlike Technology, Technology 2 doesn't override Azazel-inherent Brimstone and the laser can be fired while the Brimstone is charged.
  Technology wraps around Brimstone beams and does not override Azazel's Brimstone.
longDescription.Interactions:
Azazel: The Technology 2 laser continuously fires as Azazel charges his Brimstone. Damage is still reduced.
8 Inch Nails: The laser will constantly knock back enemies.
Brimstone: Overrides Technology 2, but retains the reduced damage.
  Laser fires continuously while Brimstone is charging.
Chocolate Milk: Tears shot from the left eye will gain the charged shot effect but the laser is unaffected.
Dead Onion: Overridden by Technology 2.
Incubus: Decreases damage of Incubus' tears; Incubus does not fire a continuous laser.
Monstro's Lung: Tears shot from the left eye will gain the charged shot effect but the laser is unaffected.
Ouija Board: Tears shot from the left eye will gain the spectral effect but the laser is unaffected.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #16 (Computer Savvy).

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac fires a spread of four tears at once.
Tears down: (Delay * 2.1) + 3
 This item belongs to the Spider Baby set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a humanoid spider.
longDescription.Interactions:
The Forgotten: Quadruples bones thrown and swung. Significant increase in tear delay.
Loki's Horns: Only occasionally fires one tear in the other three directions.
Mom's Eye: Only occasionally fires one tear out of the back of Isaac's head.
The Wiz: Four shots are fired diagonally out of each eye.
  Fires three shots diagonally out of each eye.

longDescription.Effect: +2 flat damage to tears fired from Isaac's left eye.
longDescription.Notes:
The damage bonus is unaffected by both positive and negative damage multipliers.
Cain has a 50% chance of firing a shot with the effects of Chemical Peel whenever he fires.
