Blood Clot applies to the same eye.
longDescription.Interactions:
Incubus: Tears fired by Incubus have a chance to be higher damage red tears.
The Ludovico Technique: The tear alternates between the higher damage red tear and the lower damage blue tear. A higher tear rate increases the time that the tear stays red.
Technology 2: Replaces tears fired from Isaac's right eye; the remaining tears all deal +2 Damage.

longDescription.Effect: When Isaac is hit, his active item gains 1 room's worth of charge.
longDescription.Trivia:
The Habit was significantly nerfed from the previous game. In the original game, it would restore half of Isaac's item's required charge rather than just one room's worth of charge. This could essentially make Isaac unkillable if it was used in conjunction with Yum Heart, The Nail, or Book of Revelations and The Wafer for The Womb and beyond.
This item is used in Challenge #12 (When Life Gives You Lemons).

longDescription.Effect:
Damage increases as Isaac receives damage. The damage increase stays for the whole floor, but resets upon entering a new floor.
  The first three times Isaac is hit, his damage is increased by 0.5. 
  The next three times Isaac is hit, his damage is increased by 33%. 
  Any damage taken past the sixth hit does not further increase damage.
Isaac becomes redder as his damage increases.
longDescription.Notes:
Samson starts with this item by default.
If Forget Me Now or a 5-pip Dice Room is used, the damage boost will reset.
longDescription.Trivia:
In the original Binding of Isaac, Bloody Lust only lasted for one room and the damage increase was triggered by killing enemies.
  Lusty Blood now has the effect of the original Bloody Lust.
On the character select screen, Samson's starting item is spelled as "Blood Lust".

longDescription.Effect:
Grants spectral tears and flight.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.Notes:
It is the Devil Room equivalent of the Dead Dove.
The changed texture of the player's body is the same as The Lost's, but recolored.
Lord of the Pit costs the same amount of Red Hearts as Spirit of the Night, while only granting flight and increased speed. Its strongly recommended to take Spirit of the Night if the player has the choice.
longDescription.Trivia:
The name and Isaac's appearance are a reference to the Magic: the Gathering card.
The item's icon is the Wiccan symbol for blessing.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants an extra life.
  Isaac will respawn as ??? in the previous room.
longDescription.Notes:
Because characters are respawned as???, if Azazel or The Lost are resurrected by this item, they will lose the ability to fly unless they picked up items granting such abilities.
  Azazel will also lose his short-ranged Brimstone. 
  If Lilith is resurrected she will lose Incubus and fire as any other character instead.
Like other items that grant an extra life, but respawn Isaac as a different character, all Completion Marks earned from the moment of death onwards will count towards the new character, not the old.
longDescription.Trivia:
The Ankh is an Egyptian hieroglyph that means "life".
This item works similar to Spelunky's Ankh.

longDescription.Effect: Grants a chance to trigger the Book of Shadows effect upon taking damage, creating a shield that nullifies all types of damage for 7 seconds.
longDescription.Notes:
The base chance of creating the protective shield is 20%
The activation chance of this item depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 27 Luck.
The shield negates health loss from Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars.
Does not prevent heart container loss from Health Down Pill or Devil Room deals.
Does not prevent damage from IV Bag.
longDescription.Trivia: In Galicia, Celtic crosses are usually found on top of granaries as a protective measure against any kind of evil.

longDescription.Effect:
+1 Damage.
+23% Shot Speed.
longDescription.Trivia:
A Cat o' Nine Tails is a multi-tailed whip commonly used in physical punishment and torture.
Unlike in Rebirth, in the original game Cat-O-Nine-Tails was merely a shot speed up and was widely considered by the community to be one of the worst items in the game.

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac's tears are replaced with guided missiles, like those used by the Doctor's Remote.
  Missiles deal 20 times Isaac's damage.
longDescription.Notes:
Missiles benefit from most bomb-enhancing effects.
Epic Fetus overrides most items in the game and has the highest priority of all of them, over Brimstone and Mom's Knife.
On PC, using the mouse and keyboard when obtaining this item can be helpful due to the ability to precisely target a specific area in the room, avoiding the sensitivity of a joystick or the limited directions of the arrow keys.
Isaac's tear delay determines how quickly a new missile or missile set can be fired after the previous one has landed. Barring very high tear delay, this has little effect on damage rate due to the delay of the missiles themselves.
longDescription.Interactions:
8 Inch Nails: Retains damage and knock back boost.
Anti-Gravity: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
Bomber Boy: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
Brimstone: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
  : Lasers fire in all directions upon impact of a missile.
Chocolate Milk: Missiles can't be charged, but reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%.
Cursed Eye: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
Dr. Fetus: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
Fire Mind/ Hot Bombs: Creates a fire every time a shot lands.
Homing tears: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
  : Cross-hair slowly moves towards enemies.
The Ludovico Technique: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
Monstro's Lung: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
  Adds 2 to 4 more crosshairs that orbit the main crosshair and fires a missile onto each crosshair.
Mom's Knife: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
  : Missiles explode into a circle of knives.
The Parasite: No effect.
Sad Bombs/Tammy's Head/Varicose Veins: Fires only normal tears, not missiles.
Scatter Bombs: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
Soy Milk: Not recommended. Damage of missiles will be decreased accordingly, but unlike normal tears, the fire-rate will not significantly increase.
Tiny Planet: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
The Wiz: Control of the crosshair is rotated 45 degrees clockwise. Fires 2 missiles in rapid succession.
longDescription.Trivia:
In the original game it was possible to control the crosshair with the mouse. This was removed in Rebirth.
  Mouse control can however be re-enabled by editing the options.ini file in C:\Users\<username>\Documents\My Games\Binding of Isaac Afterbirth/Rebirth and changing the line MouseControl=0 into MouseControl=1 . Also useful for The Ludovico Technique .
The Dr. Fetus and Epic Fetus items are based off of Dr. Fetus, the main villain in Super Meat Boy which is a game by Edmund McMillen (the creator of The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth).
This item is used in Challenge #11 (Glass Cannon).

longDescription.Effect:
Greatly increased damage: (Damage + 4) * 2
Tears down: (Delay * 2.1) + 3
If a tear kills an enemy, the tear travels on with the leftover damage.
longDescription.Interactions:
Dr. Fetus: Increases tear delay, and after the first bomb explodes, a second bomb appears where the first one exploded, doing roughly half the damage of the first.
The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Fires 3/4 Polyphemus tears instead of one. Tear rate is not lowered further, but the effect on damage becomes a flat +5 bonus instead.
Ipecac: Slightly increases damage, large decrease in fire rate.
Lost Contact: Isaac's tears will block enemy shots and continue on, but lose 10 damage. If the tear had less than 10 damage left, it disappears.
Soy Milk: Due to the fact that Soy Milk has the opposite effect of Polyphemus, the resulting combination will make Isaac's tears relatively normal. They still will be extremely small and have a higher fire rate than normal.
Trisagion: Damage reduction applies after Polyphemus' damage increase.
longDescription.Trivia:
Much like other eye-altering passive items, Polyphemus has a unique appearance on The Forgotten, appearing as an empty eye socket.
Polyphemus, ancient Greek for "The much vaunted", is a Cyclops. He is the son of Poseidon and the sea nymph Thoosa.
This item is used in Challenge #15 (Slow Roll).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants a chance (around 50%) of converting any red hearts pickups into soul hearts instead.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.
longDescription.Trivia: The mitre is a bishop's ceremonial headdress.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants one full Heart Container.
+0.16 shot speed.
longDescription.Trivia:
The baby attached to Isaac's face is similar in appearance to It Lives.
Stem cells are a special type of cell that can transform into any other cell, and are also what makes up an embryo in the first stages of pregnancy.

longDescription.Effect: Grants flight and one Eternal Heart.
longDescription.Notes: Taking this item as Keeper will grant flight but will not grant any blue flies in place of the Eternal Heart.

longDescription.Effect:
When taking damage, Isaac farts, dealing poison damage to all enemies in range.
  The initial fart deals 5 damage and the poison deals 21 damage over time.
   The damage over time is Isaac's base damage for 6 ticks.
longDescription.Interactions: Second Hand: The poison duration is not increased.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #13 (Beans!).

longDescription.Effect:
x2.3 damage multiplier.
+1 flat damage.
+4.125 range.
+0.75 tear height.
-0.4 tears.
-25% shot speed.
Grants homing tears.
Grants homing bombs (the effect of Bobby-Bomb).
Grants one heart container.
Replenishes all red hearts.
longDescription.Notes:
Sacred Heart has the highest damage multiplier of all passive items.
Although this item increases range, the reduction of shot speed results in a slight decrease in effective range, not accounting for homing.
longDescription.Trivia: The Sacred Heart (also known as the Most Sacred Heart of Jesus) is a devotion practiced in Catholicism, which represents "the heart of Jesus Christ God, pierced on the cross", and God's "boundless and passionate love for mankind".

longDescription.Effect:
+0.7 Tears up.
+16% Shot Speed.
Colors tears red.

Grants flight and one full heart container.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.
longDescription.Trivia:
This is based on the grail Jesus drank out of in the Last Supper, and the myth that says whoever drinks from it will be blessed.
 This item is used in Challenge #30 (The Guardian).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants spectral tears and flight.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.
longDescription.Notes:
It is the Angel Room equivalent of Spirit of the Night.
Useless for The Lost and Azazel, who have spectral tears and flight by default.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item may be a reference to the television show Arrested Development.
This item's appearance has the same body as The Lost.

longDescription.Effect:
+1 health
+0.3 damage
+0.2 tears
+0.2 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0)
+0.5 range
+1 tear height
Fills all red heart containers.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is a reference to one of Edmund McMillen's previous games, Super Meat Boy.

longDescription.Effect: Sets Isaac's bomb count to 99.
longDescription.Notes: Instead of immediately picking up Pyro, it is more efficient to first use the bombs already in Isaac's possession.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenge #13 (Beans!).
Pyro is a reference to pyromania, a disorder characterized by an obsession with setting things on fire.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants Isaac random tear effects. The possible effects are:
  20/20 
  Ball of Tar 
  Dark Matter 
  Death's Touch 
  Fire Mind 
  Iron Bar 
  Mom's Contacts 
  My Reflection 
  Mysterious Liquid 
  Number One 
  Ouija Board 
  Proptosis 
  Sagittarius 
  Scorpio 
  Speed Ball 
  Spoon Bender 
  The Inner Eye 
  Tough Love
 The type of randomized tear is determined upon entering a room.
 The type of randomized tear changes every 23 seconds. The item appears to select two tear effects at once, perhaps staggering the times at which each of those effects change.
longDescription.Notes:
If a run is quit, and then continued, 3 Dollar Bill will have a new random tear effect for the current room.
 The Proptosis effect is bugged for 3 Dollar Bill, and will only fire half the range it would normally (damage is increased normally).
 Combining with the Rainbow Worm trinket, tears become very chaotic, sometimes hazardous but very entertaining.
 Unlike Fruit Cake, which can only modify individual tears, 3 Dollar Bill can modify stats as well.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is a reference to an old expression "queer as a three dollar bill".
 This item is used in Challenge #28 (PRIDE DAY!).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants Isaac one red heart container.
+0.3 Damage up.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is a reference to Bonk's Adventure.
The throbbing vein on Isaac's head is commonly used in comics to display the emotion of anger on a character's face.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.16 Shot speed.
Upon pickup, drops a random tarot card on the ground nearby.
longDescription.Trivia: Isaac appears to be wearing a fortune teller's head-dress upon picking up the item. This most likely refers to the Magic 8 Ball's association with fortune telling or advice seeking.

longDescription.Effect:
Upon pickup, four random pills will spawn around Isaac.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.Interactions: Starter Deck: Drops four cards/runes rather than pills.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.4 Tears.
Spawns two soul hearts
longDescription.Trivia: Squeezy appears to be a Panic Pete squeeze toy.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.5 Damage up.
+0.25 Range up.
+0.5 Tear height.
longDescription.Trivia: Jesus juice is slang for the red wine used in Holy Communion, which is supposed to signify the blood of Jesus. When children take communion, instead of letting them have wine, most churches will let them have grape juice instead, which is why the item is a box of grape juice.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns:
  1 coin 
  1 key 
  1 bomb 
  1 heart 
  1 card/rune 
  1 pill 
  1 trinket
longDescription.Notes:
The Box will not always spawn the default pickups.
  Instead of a bomb, it could drop a troll bomb, a 1+1 bomb, or a Gold Bomb. 
  This is also true for hearts (1+1 Hearts), coins (nickel, dime), and keys (key ring).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants two keys.
Generates additional pickups from chests.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.Trivia:
Mom's Key is the first item, by ID number, that was not carried over from Wrath of the Lamb.
The appearance of Mom's Key is a reference to Bowser's boss key in Super Mario 64 as well as the Boss Key in various Legend of Zelda games.

longDescription.Effect:
Gives a chance to shoot charming tears, causing enemies to temporarily fight on Isaac's side.
  The charming effect depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 27 Luck.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.

+0.3 Damage.
Adds a chance to shoot concussive tears, causing enemies to walk around randomly.
longDescription.Notes: Concussive tear effect depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 27 Luck.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #3 (Head Trauma).

longDescription.Effect:
Upon contact with enemies, deals damage equal to the number of coins Isaac has.
  Damage is dealt up to twice per second per enemy.
Freezes and turns enemies into gold upon contact with Isaac.
  Enemies killed while in this state will drop 1-4 pennies .
longDescription.Notes:
With Midas' Touch, some effects that create poop may instead create golden poop (see Synergies for details).
When used against Mom, Mom's foot can usually be hit and will be turned into gold without the player taking damage.
When used against Satan, Satan's foot will be turned into gold and receive a lot of damage.
 When used against Ultra Greed, his armor will be partially impaired to a 25% efficiency.
Spawning Multiplayer Babies while the player has Midas' Touch will give the Midas' Touch effects (freeze on touch + damage) to the baby itself. This can be abused, considering the baby's invincibility frames upon spawning:
  Spawn the baby using the Enter key. It is invincible for a short period of time. 
  During this period, stay in contact with enemies to freeze them and damage them.
This can be used to gather 99 coins very quickly, and in turn, deal massive damage with Midas' Touch damage component.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is a reference to King Midas from Greek Mythology, who was able to turn everything he touched with his hand into gold and ended up accidentally turning his own daughter into a golden statue.

longDescription.Effect:
Transforms all Heart, Bomb, Penny, and Key pickups into their respective 1+1 versions.
  Does not work with Soul Hearts , Black Hearts , half Red Hearts , Nickels , Dimes , or drops from The Book of Sin . 
  Does not work with Gold Hearts , Lucky Pennies , or Sticky Nickels .
longDescription.Notes:
By bombing Donation Machines, the player can earn more money than is taken from the machine, giving an endless supply of coins until the machine breaks or the player runs out of bombs.
  This is especially effective with Bomber Boy , as a single bomb can yield upwards of 20 coins.
When used while fighting Greed, Hangers, or Keepers, every coin knocked out of Isaac will be worth two coins, allowing Isaac to net a profit.
longDescription.Trivia:
The item is a reference to the Humble Bundle, collections of games and soundtracks that are sold online through a "pay what you want" system. The original Binding of Isaac was represented in three humble bundles.
This item displays "Humbleing Bundle" when picked up. The word "humbleing" is a common misspelling of the word "humbling", though it is unknown if this is an intentional typo or a mistake.

longDescription.Effect: Grants a chance to drop a random Coin, Bomb, Key, or Heart whenever Isaac takes damage.
longDescription.Notes: Fanny Pack can drop Soul Hearts, Bone Hearts, and Eternal Hearts but not Black Hearts
longDescription.Trivia: Fanny packs are basically purses attached that can be strapped to the stomach.

longDescription.Effect:
If Isaac's current activated item has no charges, attempting to activate the item fully recharges it in exchange for two hearts of Isaac's health.
  If the item has any charges, the Sharp Plug will not work.
longDescription.Notes:
If Isaac has less than two black or soul hearts, it will remove them but will not remove any red hearts.
The Lost does not benefit from this item unless they have a respawn because their active item's charge will not refill if the Holy Mantle effect activates. Sharp Plug only activates upon receiving actual damage.
 When used by Keeper, it will only drain one coin heart.
longDescription.Interactions:
9 Volt: Renders the Sharp Plug unusable. Sharp Plug can only be used if the item is at 0 charge, but 9 Volt instantly gives 1 charge to the item upon activation.
Holy Mantle: Holy Mantle blocks the damage from Sharp Plug if the shield is active, but also keeps Isaac's active item from charging.
Isaac's Heart: Renders the Sharp Plug unusable.
Mega Blast: Sharp Plug will not work with Mega Blast.

longDescription.Effect:
+1 Damage.
Increases the chance for champion enemies to appear by 15%.
longDescription.Notes:
While more champions likely mean a tougher run, players will also profit from a higher amount of Pickups available to them, thanks to many champions dropping items upon death.
 The chance for champions to appear does not increase in The Void.
longDescription.Interactions: Purple Heart: Champion Belt's increased chance is also doubled.
longDescription.Trivia: The item resembles a championship belt in wrestling, MMA, boxing and other similar commercialised fighting competitions.

longDescription.Effect:
Gives the player 5 bombs.
Bombs now cloud up the screen on detonation, briefly confusing and dealing 10 damage to all enemies in the room.
longDescription.Notes:
Butt Bombs heal Brownie, Dangle, and Dingle.
  The Butt Bomb effect on Dr. Fetus or Epic Fetus does not cause healing, but normal bombs still do.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenges #2 (High Brow) and #13 (Beans!).

longDescription.Effect:
Upon pickup, Isaac gets a small brown ringtail.
After standing still and not pressing the move or attack buttons for one second, Isaac will turn into an invincible statue.
  Using bombs and active items will remove the invincibility state. 
  Bombs can be placed while stationary and safely be stood on until they blow up if no other inputs are done after placing the bomb.
longDescription.Notes: While invulnerable, Little Horns pitfall still affects the player and will teleport them throughout the room; however, damage is not dealt.
longDescription.Interactions: My Little Unicorn/The Gamekid/Unicorn Stump: Statue form can activate while invulnerable.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is a reference to the Super Leaf from Super Mario Bros. 3, which grants the player the Tanooki suit. The Tanooki Suit also has a Tanuki tail and the ability to turn into a statue.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns 1-2 friendly blue spider(s) upon taking damage.
 This item belongs to the Spider Baby set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a humanoid spider.
longDescription.Notes: Essentially Infestation's spider equivalent.
longDescription.Interactions:
Fish Tail: No effect.
Hive Mind: Increases spider size and doubles damage.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenge #18 (The Host).
Possibly a reference to an episode in the sitcom Father Ted.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants Isaac a permanent 50% chance to resurrect on death.
  Resurrection leaves Isaac at 1/2 of a red heart . 
  Guppy's Collar takes priority over all other resurrection items when activated.
This item belongs to the Guppy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Guppy.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is a tribute to Edmund's cat Guppy.[1]
This item may also be a reference to the Schrdinger's Cat thought experiment.
It is possible to obtain two collars by finding one in a red chest, without picking it up, and then finding another collar in a different red chest. However, this does not have any additional effects and does not count towards transforming into Guppy.
Resurrecting in a Curse Room may trap Isaac if he has no way of recovering health or exiting them without losing health.

longDescription.Effect:
Gives Isaac's tears a shield surrounding them, allowing the player to block enemy shots.
  Isaac's shots are destroyed upon contact with an enemy's shot. 
  Affects every familiar's tears. 
  No longer affects any familiar's tears besides Fate's Reward and Incubus .
-16% Shot Speed.
longDescription.Interactions:
Dr. Fetus: Bombs will not destroy or block shots. Stat effects apply.
Epic Fetus: Missiles will not destroy or block shots. Stat effects apply.
 Fire Mind: Lost Contact will remove the chance to explode on impact effect.
God's Flesh: Tears with the shrink effect do not appear to be shielded, but will still block enemy shots.
Godhead: Auras will not block shots but tears will.
Haemolacria: Main tears will block shots but burst tears cannot.
Ipecac: Ipecac shot will explode upon contact with an enemy's shot.
Lachryphagy: Tears often block shots before they can burst; however, burst tears can also block shots.
Kidney Stone: Stone will not block shots.
Mysterious Liquid: Overridden by Lost Contact.
Rubber Cement: Tears will bounce off of enemy tears and destroy them.
Tough Love: Teeth will not appear to be shielded but will still block enemy shots.

longDescription.Effect:
Upon taking damage, Isaac leaves a trail of red creep that damages enemies until he leaves the room.
+5 range.
longDescription.Notes:
The effects of this item do not stack if multiple copies of the item or its effects are acquired; Isaac only gets the range bonus once.
Lazarus, or anyone holding Lazarus' Rags, is resurrected with this item upon his first death.
  After Challenge 31: Backasswards is beaten, Lazarus will start with Anemic, and Lazarus Risen will have its +5 range and creep trail effect permanently active, regardless of whether he actually possesses the item.
longDescription.Interactions: Lost Cork: Increases creep trail size.
longDescription.Trivia: Anemia is a decrease in the blood's ability to carry oxygen. This can either be caused by a decrease in hemoglobin in blood cells, or red blood cells altogether.

longDescription.Effect:
A Devil Room / Angel Room Door will always spawn after every boss fight, excluding the first floor and floors after Utero II/Womb II/Scarred Womb II.
  The spawned door will not disappear when leaving and re-entering the boss room.
longDescription.Notes:
The precise effect involves setting the Devil Room Chance to 100%, regardless of other effects.
  Even if taken after a boss is killed, Goat Head will force a Devil / Angel Room Door to spawn on that floor.
Accepting a deal with the devil will prevent any Angel Rooms from appearing, meaning that Isaac needs to acquire the Goat Head in a Curse Room, Golden Chest, Red Chest, or with Credit Card in order to allow Angel Rooms to open.
 Goat Head and The Book of Belial are the only items that will ensure Angel/Devil Rooms on every floor between Basement I and Utero II.
 Goat Head will not force a Devil / Angel Room Door to open if the Boss Fight was in a narrow room.
 Goat Head has no effect in Greed Mode. Because of this, it is removed from every item pool in Greed Mode.
longDescription.Interactions: Eucharist: Overrides Goat Head.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is a reference to how goats and their blood were often used as a common sacrifice proxy. This is even more evident by the pickup quote.

longDescription.Effect:
+1 Damage.
Grants 3 Black Hearts.
longDescription.Notes: When purchased at a Devil Room by ??? (or another character who has lost all heart containers) this item effectively converts 3 soul hearts (or fewer, depending on current health) into 3 black hearts, increasing damage at no downside.

longDescription.Effect:
Allows Isaac to spawn friendly spiders when firing tears.
Heals Isaac for 1 red heart upon pickup.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.Notes:
The spiders are spawned when Isaac is shooting, and up to 5 spiders can be spawned in the same time. More spiders can be spawned if the previous ones died.
The spider spawning chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% with 10 Luck.
This item does not work for Lilith, since Incubus tears do not count as her own tears.
Spiders can be spawned in rooms without enemies.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants one full Heart Container when picked up.
Isaac has a chance to regenerate half of a red heart every one minute of gameplay.
longDescription.Notes:
The regeneration can happen multiple times in the same room, so there is no need to move between rooms to continue regeneration.
It is possible to regenerate all missing hearts by simply standing in the same room for a while. Players may want to take a short break with the game not paused in order to regenerate all of their health.
Regeneration does not occur when standing in a Crawl Space.
 Regeneration occurs with Keeper; it will restore a full health coin for him.
 Regeneration occurs with The Forgotten, restoring a third of a bone heart.
Regeneration will not occur for ???, as he only has soul hearts.
longDescription.Interactions: Maggy's Bow: No effect on regen.
longDescription.Trivia:
A Placenta is an organ that forms from the mother's uterus during pregnancy that supports the unborn child during development until it is expelled during childbirth. In some cultures, it is a common practice for the mother and/or child to eat the expelled placenta.
  This, like many other things Isaac does, is medically inadvisable.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants the player an empty heart container.
Adds a chance of dropping a red heart whenever Isaac takes damage.
longDescription.Notes: Old Bandage's Red Heart drop chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 50% at 29 Luck.

longDescription.Effect:
Upon exploding, Bombs shoot 10 tears off in every direction, similar to Tammy's Head. The tears are affected by any tear modifiers Isaac has on his own tears.
Grants five bombs.
longDescription.Notes: The tears generated by the bombs can push other bombs. Dropping multiple Sad Bombs is not advised since they could be pushed near you.
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Does not affect the amount of tears when bombs explode.
Explosivo: Tear explosions are not affected by Sad Bombs.
Ipecac: Normal Ipecac shots won't explode into tears, but placed bombs will shoot Ipecac shots in every direction.
The Ludovico Technique/Marked: Tears that burst from bombs cannot be controlled.
My Reflection: Tears will return to the place where the bomb exploded, not Isaac.
Tiny Planet: Tears orbit around where bomb exploded not Isaac.
Tech.5: No effect.
Technology 2: Bombs only explode into tears with a slight damage reduction.

longDescription.Effect:
Makes tears bounce off walls, enemies and environmental objects.
  Tears that bounce off of enemies bounce in random directions, whereas tears that bounce off of walls and other objects bounce directly back. 
  Tears bounce off bombs.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Rubber Cement.
  Brimstone bounces off walls, creating a second beam that does half damage. 
  Azazel's Brimstone will continue to full length after bouncing, but will deal half of damage. 
  Azazel's Brimstone will now no longer continue to full length after bouncing, and instead bounce as a regular mini-Brimstone.
Bob's Rotten Head: The bomb bounces back at the player upon hitting an obstacle.
Continuum: Overridden by Rubber Cement; tears will still bounce off of walls and obstacles.
 The Forgotten: No effect on the skeleton form's attacks.
Homing Tears: Tears will bounce off enemies and home back in, but to deal damage to that enemy again they must bounce off a wall.
Ipecac: Tears will bounce off of walls, but not off of enemies.
Jacob's Ladder: Tears don't generate arcs when hitting obstacles.
Lost Contact: Tears will bounce off of enemy tears.
The Ludovico Technique: Overrides Rubber Cement.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Rubber Cement.
The Parasite: Tears will bounce off of walls without splitting, but split and bounce when hitting enemies. The split tears and the original one will bounce off everything.
Piercing Tears: Tears will bounce off enemies instead of going straight through them, but the tears can still damage enemies such as Knights that are normally invulnerable from the front.
Sinus Infection: Boogers stick to enemies, but otherwise they bounce normally.
Spectral Tears: Overridden by Rubber Cement.
  Tears pass through obstacles but bounce off walls.
Sulfuric Acid: Overridden by Rubber Cement.
Technology / Technology 2: Overrides Rubber Cement.
  Laser bounces off walls, creating a second beam that does half damage.
Tiny Planet: Tears no longer fly over obstacles but instead bounce very quickly along them, appearing to "vibrate".
  Tears pass through obstacles but coast along walls, trying to maintain the circular trajectory.
longDescription.Trivia: The item's appearance is loosely based off Elmer's Glue brand Rubber Cement.

longDescription.Effect:
Holding the fire buttons causes tears to hover in midair. When released, the tears will all shoot in the direction they were originally fired.
  If the fire buttons are not released, the tears will fire on their own after a while.
-2 tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.
longDescription.Notes:
Gravitational effects, such as Mega Fatty's inhalation or a Gaping Maw will pull floating tears toward them.
The range attribute only affects the lifespan of the tears after they have been released.
Hovering tears can damage monsters like Knights or Mask of Infamy from the front, even if they don't have the piercing effect.
longDescription.Interactions:
Bob's Rotten Head: Continues to hover in air while the fire button is pressed after launching it.
Brimstone: A red mist expands and then contracts, doing contact damage to any enemy that touches it. It then fires the original Brimstone shot before disappearing. Allows a new shot to be charged up immediately after firing without interrupting the first shot. Does not increase the range of Azazel's Brimstone beam.
  Brimstone + Conjoined : Fires a single laser instead of a triple laser.
Chocolate Milk: Overrides Anti-Gravity.
  Chocolate Milk + Soy Milk : Tears are released immediately, despite not charging.
Compound Fracture / Cricket's Body / Haemolacria / The Parasite: Burst tears will not hover even if a fire button is held.
Cursed Eye: Overrides Anti-Gravity except for tears delay down which applies.
Diplopia: No effect; -2 tears delay does not stack.
Dr. Fetus: Only tear delay down applies.
Epic Fetus: Only tear delay down applies.
Euthanasia: If a needle tear destroys an enemy and the fire button is held, the burst needles will hover until the button is released.
Kidney Stone: When the Kidney Stone effect is activated, the tear barrage will hover until released. The stone will not hover and will travel regardless.
The Ludovico Technique: Only tear delay down applies.
A Lump of Coal: Despite the visual increase in size, damage still only increases based on the distance traveled.
  Tears no longer increase in size while hovering.
Marked: Only tear delay down applies.
Mom's Knife: Only tear delay down applies.
Monstro's Lung: Only tear delay down applies.
Multidimensional Baby: Multidimensional Baby will travel the same path as the Anti-Gravity tears, easily doubling any stationary shots. Any moving tears that hit it will produce a normal moving copy, however stationary tears will spawn a copy that will eventually fall to the ground even after the direction is released.
  Stationary duplicated tears will release normally.
My Reflection: Combines both effects. Tears will home in on Isaac instead of remaining stationary, and releasing the attack buttons will launch the tears from their position as usual.
Technology: Only tear delay down applies.
Tech X: Only tear delay down applies.
longDescription.Trivia:
Isaac's appearance bears a strong resemblance to the character Dr. Manhattan of the graphic novel Watchmen.
After picking up Anti-Gravity, whenever Isaac picks up an item that alters the appearance of his face, his head becomes the same color as Blue Baby's.
This item is used in Challenge #17 (Waka Waka).

longDescription.Effect:
+5 bombs
All explosions heal Isaac for one red heart instead of damaging him. If Isaac has no red heart containers or full health, no damage is taken.
longDescription.Notes:
Makes the player immune to Mom's, Satan's, and other enemies' stomp attacks, making those fights substantially less difficult.
  Due to the immunity to Mom's stomping attack, Mom's Toenail has improved usefulness.
Makes the player immune to The Cage's, The Adversary's, and Mega Satan's rock wave attack.
The item is unable to produce Soul Hearts, Black Hearts, or Eternal Hearts, making Pyromaniac a little less effective if used with ??? or The Lost. However, these characters still gain immunity to explosions.
Makes the player immune to fires left behind by enemies and their hot bombs, as well as projectiles from Red and Purple Fireplaces but not the fireplaces themselves.
 Ultra Greed's second form in Greedier Mode uses explosive attacks almost exclusively. As a result, Pyromaniac makes characters nearly invulnerable against him.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenge #23 (Blue Bomber).
Pyromania is an impulse control disorder in which individuals repeatedly fail to resist impulses to deliberately start fires.

longDescription.Effect:
When Isaac's normal tears disappear (either from hitting the ground or hitting something else), they spawn 4 smaller tears.
  Each smaller tear deals half of Isaac's normal damage.
Slightly increases the size of the tear.
-10 range
-1 tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.
longDescription.Notes:
Any status effect carrying tears: split tears will carry the same status effect.
If Isaac has less than 10 range, the split tears appear but cannot actually cause damage before hitting the floor.
  Cain , Lazarus and Samson have lower starting range and are particularly susceptible. 
  Tear height has no effect on this downside.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Cricket's Body.
Dead Onion: Significantly decreases effective range, potentially preventing the split tears from causing damage.
Diplopia: No effect.
Dr. Fetus: Greatly reduces range, bombs do not split.
  The bombs fired by Dr. Fetus will split into smaller bombs, much like Scatter Bombs .
Epic Fetus: Only tear stat change applies.
Euthanasia: Needle tears will split into 4 small needle tears upon hitting the ground or an enemy. Split tears produced have chance to deal triple damage, but will not cause tear bursts.
Flat Stone: Tears will usually only bounce twice, unless Isaac has high range, and spawns burst tears when they bounce.
Kidney Stone: Drastically decreases range, potentially preventing the split tears from causing damage. The stone will not split.
The Ludovico Technique: Overrides Cricket's Body except for stat effects which apply.
Mom's Knife: Range of the knife is significantly decreased.
Number One: Drastically decreases range, potentially preventing the split tears from causing damage.
Piercing tears: Tears will only split after landing on the ground.
Spectral tears: Tears will only split after landing on the ground.
Technology: Overrides Cricket's Body except for stat effects which apply.
Tech X: Overrides Cricket's Body except for stat effects which apply.
longDescription.Trivia: Cricket's Body is named after Edmund's former cat, Cricket.

longDescription.Effect:
Whenever Isaac takes damage, there is a chance that a Soul Heart or a Black Heart might spawn.
Enemies have a chance to drop a Half Red Heart after being killed.
longDescription.Notes: Gimpy's Soul Heart drop chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 50% at 22 Luck.
longDescription.Trivia:
Gimpy is a reference to the movie Pulp Fiction, in which a minor character known as "The Gimp" is depicted wearing a leather BDSM suit including a mask much like the one Isaac wears in possession of Gimpy.
The "Sweet Suffering" flavor text is a reference to BDSM. Specifically, it references masochism, which is when sexual pleasure is derived from pain.
Much like Gish and Sisters Vis, this item could possibly be a reference to the "Gimp" enemy in Gish, who wears a BDSM mask.

longDescription.Effect: Grants a full red heart container, a soul heart, and a black heart.
longDescription.Trivia:
This is a reference to the iconic card of the same name from Magic: the Gathering, a collectible card game Edmund McMillen played since his childhood.
  Its powerful effect of producing three Mana of any color is reflected by the ingame item's effect of adding three hearts of different colors to the player's health. 
  The fact that it's one of the rarest and most expensive commercially released cards in the game might also be referenced by the fact that it's a relatively hard item to come across, being only a rare find exclusively in secret rooms .

longDescription.Effect:
Adds 3 coins on pickup.
When Isaac takes damage 1-2 pennies will drop.
  When held by Keeper , it will drop 0-1 pennies instead.
longDescription.Notes:
If Keeper collects this item with 1 health coin, it will heal a coin and add 2 coins to his inventory.
Unlike the coins dropped from being hit by a shot from a Keeper, Greed or Super Greed, the coins that are dropped from the piggy bank are not subtracted from Isaac's total.
Can appear in the shop and the item room on the same floor, but picking up multiple copies of the item does not cause its effect to stack.
The drops from Piggy Bank, unlike Swallowed Penny, are locked to normal pennies, instead of random types of coins.
longDescription.Trivia: This item might be a reference to the similar item in Risk Of Rain called Life Savings, as suggested by its description.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a chance to shoot fear tears, causing enemies to run away from the player.
-1 tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.Notes:
The fear effect chance depends on the luck stat, reaching 100% with 85 luck.
  Dark Matter is significantly better at inflicting fear than Mom's Perfume.
longDescription.Interactions:
Diplopia: Tear delay does not stack.
Lachryphagy: If a fear tear is fed, all burst tears cause fear. If a normal tear is fed, the burst tears cannot cause fear.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants a charged shot that fires 14 tears in the same fashion as Monstro.
  The attack can be released only when fully charged. Tear delay is increased by roughly 4.5x.
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20 / The Inner Eye / Mutant Spider: Adds 2, 5 or 7 tears to the barrage respectively.
  20/20 + The Inner Eye: 10 extra tears. 
  20/20 + Mutant Spider: 14 extra tears. 
  The Inner Eye + Mutant Spider: 14 extra tears. 
  All three: 19 extra tears.
Chemical Peel: Overridden by Monstro's Lung.
  Tears have a 50% chance to be Chemical Peel tears.
Cursed Eye: Overridden by Monstro's Lung.
 Epic Fetus: Launches 3-5 cursors that rotate around each other before the missiles land.
Epiphora: No effect. Tears stat is increased properly but firing cancels the effect.
 Kidney Stone: If Monstro's Lung is picked up while Kidney Stone is ready to fire, charge time for Monstro's Lung will be significantly decreased.
  Only stat effects from Kidney Stone apply.
Loki's Horns/Mom's Eye: Isaac will still fire single tears in the other direction(s).
 The Ludovico Technique: Tear becomes a cluster of variably sized tears spread over a small area. The tears move at the same speed when controlled but constantly move around each other.
Marked: Only stat effects from Marked apply.
My Reflection: Tears stay in the air much longer and consistently, allowing better reach and more focused blasts before they arc back.
Strange Attractor: Due to the high concentration of tears enemies will be pulled into Isaac at great force, in certain cases enough force to pull enemies through rocks.
Tech X: Fires a group of laser rings with size dependent on how long they were charged, with increased charge time.
Technology: If picked up after Technology, Monstro's Lung has no effect. Technology will override Monstro's Lung with very low tear shot.
  Charge effect is removed and fire rate returned to normal. Extra lasers will be shot in random directions around Isaac while firing.
The Wiz: 7-8 tears are fired at each diagonal direction instead of a full burst.

longDescription.Effect:
+1.5 damage.
+0.2 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).
Grants 6 black hearts.
Removes all red heart containers.
  Will not remove bone hearts , but will empty them.
Adds a chance to shoot fear tears.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.Notes:
The chance to fire a fear tear depends on Isaac's luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 85 Luck.
  Dark Matter is significantly better at inflicting fear than Abaddon.
Does not remove soul hearts or eternal hearts.
As it removes all red heart containers, other devil deals can be taken for "free" as long as Abaddon is taken last while still having at least 1 container.
Has no negative trade-off when taken as ???, except the revoked chance of an angel room.
Likewise, The Lost gets a significant speed and damage increase.
Can always be taken when offered as a 3 soul heart devil deal. Even if the player only has one or two soul hearts, six black hearts will be granted after taking the item.
longDescription.Trivia:
In the Hebrew Bible, the name Abaddon is used in reference to a bottomless pit, often appearing alongside the place of the dead (which is known as Sheol), meaning the land of the dead. The actual Hebrew word Abaddon ( - pronounced avadon) means "doom".
Abaddon is the Hebrew equivalent of Apollyon.
In the New Testament Book of Revelation, an angel called Abaddon is written as the king of an army of locusts; his name is first transcribed in Greek (Revelation 9:11  "whose name in Hebrew Abaddon").
Abaddon also shares its name with a level from Edmund's previous game Super Meat Boy.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a chance to shoot slowing tears, reducing the speed of enemy movement and any projectiles they fire.
Isaac leaves a trail of slowing black creep.
longDescription.Notes: The probability of shooting a slowing tear depends on Isaac's luck, going up to 100% at 18 luck.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is based on the appearance of Gish, the titular main character of one of Edmund McMillen's earlier games and a boss in Rebirth.

Stop_Watch.shortDescription: Let's slow this down a bit...

longDescription.Effect:
Automatically inflicts slow to all enemies in every room.
  The slow is only applied after the player is hit.
+0.3 speed.
longDescription.Notes:
Once activated, the effect lasts permanently.
  The background music is also slowed down to 70% of the original speed of the music.
The Broken Watch is an item similar to this item, but functions in a different way.
Because of the slow effect, champion versions of enemies will be tinted the same color as all other enemies. This makes it much harder to distinguish certain champion types, such as those that explode upon death.
Pokys, Slides and Mega Troll Bombs are not affected and will move in their regular speed.
 Stop Watch is a special item.
longDescription.Interactions:
Broken Watch: Overridden by Stop Watch; the speed up effect will not occur.
  Both the slow effect and the rarer speed up can trigger at the start of a room.
longDescription.Trivia: The Stop Watch is a reference to the Stopwatch from the Castlevania series.

longDescription.Effect:
Range greatly increased.
+7 tear height.
Grants spectral tears.
Tears now revolve around Isaac at a fixed distance until they hit the ground.
longDescription.Notes: Tears will not hit directly in front of Isaac; aiming directly away from enemies is often effective.
longDescription.Interactions:
Epic Fetus: Overrides Tiny Planet.
Haemolacria: Fired tears orbit around the character, but burst tears do not orbit the character.
Hook Worm: Has no effect.
The Ludovico Technique: Tear orbits around Isaac, however, the orbit can be grown or shrunken, sped up or slowed down by using the firing keys.
Mom's Knife: The knife will spiral out clockwise from where it is held, and then return along the same path. The distance that it moves is proportional to how long the throw is charged, as per usual. This makes the knife much more difficult to use effectively.
Monstro's Lung: This item removes the extra height and range bonuses, causing the burst of tears to circle around and land behind the player after only being airborne for a short time.
My Reflection: Tears will move to maintain their orbital positions around Isaac as he moves, making aiming much easier.
Pop!: Tears tend to clump together behind the character and then disappear after a few seconds.
Proptosis: At base damage, tears disappear after half an orbit.
Ring Worm: Every single tear spins uncontrollably fast, making aiming incredibly difficult. However, with large shots (Death's Touch with high damage, for instance) this combo can fill the entire screen with projectiles almost immediately.
The Parasite: Tears only split when hitting objects and enemies.
Tractor Beam: Overrides Tiny Planet but keeps the tear height effectively giving Isaac spectral tears.
  Tractor Beam + Rubber Cement : Tears will travel along the beam until they hit a wall and then orbit Isaac.
Wiggle Worm: The tear forcefully orbits while spiraling. The orbit amplifies the wiggle.
longDescription.Trivia:
Tiny Planet was considered as a cosmetic item in Team Fortress 2, alongside Skatole, tears, and Brimstone.
This item is used in Challenge #3 (Head Trauma).
The item is likely a reference to asteroids.

longDescription.Effect: Spawns an allied blue spider from each enemy killed.
longDescription.Notes:
Enemies do not spawn spiders when killed by anything not controlled by Isaac (environmental hazards, charmed enemies, death upon clearing room, etc).
Enemies do not spawn spiders when killed by blue spiders.
Blue flies can also spawn spiders.
Enemies killed by familiars will spawn blue spiders.
Destroying dead shopkeepers will spawn blue spiders.
Killing Pin will give one spider for each of his segments.
Killing Chub will spawn a lot of blue spiders.
Killing a Homunculus or a Begotten will sometimes spawn a blue spider for each segment in the chains holding them to the wall.
 Black Balls spawned by Little Horn can also drop blue spiders upon death.

longDescription.Effect: Enemies that touch Isaac are turned into Poop.
longDescription.Notes:
Poop created by this item is not grid-aligned, and flashes red when hit, similar to damaging Monsters.
  Does not work on bosses.
If you touch the middle section of a Grub with E Coli, it will then split and become two heads (rather than destroying and spawning Maggots).
Mullibooms can be turned into poop without taking damage.
The poops vanish if the room is left and then returned to.
 This item belongs to the Oh Crap set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking pile of poop.
longDescription.Interactions:
Hallowed Ground: The generated poops cannot be white.
Meconium: The generated poops cannot be black.
longDescription.Trivia:
Escherichia coli is a type of intestinal bacteria present naturally in the human intestinal system. However, some harmful strains of E coli can cause food poisoning.
This item is used in Challenge #2 (High Brow).

longDescription.Effect:
+1.5 Damage
-0.3 Tears
Grants piercing tears.
Increases tear size.
Cosmetic effect: Tears are replaced by Death's scythes.
longDescription.Notes: While tear size is directly determined by damage, the scythes of Death's Touch are always bigger than their tear counterpart for any given damage value.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Death's Touch, except for stat effects.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Death's Touch, except for stat effects.
Haemolacria: Stat effects apply. Fired tears will retain piercing effect; however, burst tears will not. All other effects do not apply.
Ipecac: Fires explosive scythes. Piercing effect does not apply.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Death's Touch, except for stat effects.
Tech X: Stat effects apply; however, tear size and cosmetic effect do not apply.
Trisagion: Stat effects and piercing effects apply; however, tear size and cosmetic effect do not apply.

longDescription.Effect:
Randomly increases 4 and decreases 2 of the character's stats. If a stat that is already at an upper or lower limit is chosen, there is no visible effect.
Each increase or decrease for a stat will change it by a fixed value:
  1 health . 
  1 damage . 
  0.2 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0). 
  0.5 range . 
  0.5 tears . 
  0.2 shot speed . 
  1 luck .
 This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.
longDescription.Notes:
Despite the item's description, the item does not actually increase all stats or shuffle them.
The stat changes are permanent and will not go away if the item is removed.
 The item works more unpredictably, with always at least one stat increase and one decrease and the same stats can be increased/decreased multiple times.
  There will never be more than three stat decreases.

longDescription.Effect:
Doubles any pickups and chests earned for clearing a room.
Decreases the chance for room drops by roughly 33%.
  Neither effect applies to coins dropped in Greed Mode.
longDescription.Trivia:
A reference to the card of the same name from Magic: the Gathering, a collectible card game Edmund McMillen played since his childhood.
Isaac's name is written at the bottom of the contract, implying that he signed the contract.

longDescription.Effect: Adds a high chance to block projectiles hitting Isaac directly. When effectively blocking a projectile, Isaac will briefly flash blue.
longDescription.Notes:
Although the item's pickup quote is "Damage Reduction", Infamy does not reduce the damage taken with every hit. Instead, the total damage received from multiple projectiles is reduced.
  Likewise, although the character's sprite shows the mask on the front, it can block projectiles from any direction.
When combined with Host Hat, Isaac gains a very high chance to block projectiles.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is a reference to the Mask of Infamy boss.
This item is used in Challenge #5 (The Tank).

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac uses a shield to block shots.
The shield stays in the same direction until Isaac fires in another direction.
longDescription.Notes:
The shield can block diagonally by holding down 2 arrow keys at once.
  Tears will be fired vertically while the shield is at an angle.
The shield can't block beams or explosions.
The shield can be held in any direction if you're using a joystick.
longDescription.Interactions:
BFFS!: No effect.
Notched Axe: While using this item, the shield stays in place. It returns when the effect ends.
Maw of the Void: Trinity shield briefly stays fixed in place during the start of the effect.
longDescription.Trivia:
The item is a reference to the Shield of the Trinity.
 This item is used in Challenge #26 (I RULE!).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants an unlimited range piercing laser with random rate of fire that does not replace tears.
The laser occasionally fires with the effect of a random item or trinket, including:
  Hook Worm 
  Spoon Bender 
  Tiny Planet 
  Mysterious Liquid 
  Rubber Cement
longDescription.Notes:
The damage of the laser scales directly with Isaac's damage.
Unlike Technology or Technology 2, Isaac can still fire tears from both eyes in addition to firing the laser.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Tech.5 does not fire. However, it will still fire when playing as Azazel with his short-ranged Brimstone. Since the laser scales with player damage, this can be a devastating combination.
  Tech.5 fires normally while Brimstone laser is charging.
 Lilith: No effect, as Lilith is inherently Blindfolded.
The Ludovico Technique: Laser is fired in the same direction that the controlled tear is moving.

longDescription.Effect: Isaac fires two tears at once, one from each eye.
longDescription.Notes: Unlike other multiple shot items like Mutant Spider or The Inner Eye, 20/20 does not reduce rate of fire, effectively doubling damage per second potential. However, it does not synergize with as many items as the other shot multipliers do.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides 20/20.
 The Inner Eye: Overrides 20/20.
 Mom's Knife: Overrides 20/20.
 Monstro's Lung: Overrides 20/20.
 Mutant Spider: Overrides 20/20.
Sad Bombs: Does not affect the amount of tears when bombs explode.
 Technology: Overrides 20/20.
Varicose Veins: No effect on amount of tears when taking damage.
longDescription.Trivia:
20/20 is an idiom that refers to someone with near perfect vision.
Curiously, Isaac can throw tears even though his eyes are covered by lenses.
Despite only having one eye, Cain shoots two tears at once with this item.
 20/20's icon is white-tinted in Afterbirth.

longDescription.Effect: Displays Secret Rooms and Super Secret Rooms on the mini map.
longDescription.Notes: Blue Map will display the additional Secret Room granted by Fragmented Card.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #10 (Cursed!).

longDescription.Effect:
Increases the size and doubles damage of familiars that deal damage through tears and contact damage.
  Other familiars can be affected in non obvious ways.
longDescription.Notes:
Familiars that do not deal damage only obtain a cosmetic increase in size but do not gain any benefit. For certain pickup-generating familiars, it increases the frequency that they drop pickups.
Familiars summoned by a trinket or by Monster Manual are also affected by this item.
The blue flies and blue spiders benefit from Hive Mind instead.
longDescription.Interactions:
Evil Eye: The eyes are not treated as familiars and therefore will not synergize with BFFS!
Isaac's Heart: Increases the size of the heart's hitbox, making it easier to get hit.
Juicy Sack: Spawns an extra blue spider.
longDescription.Trivia:
BFF stands for Best Friends Forever.
This item is used in challenge #19 (The Family Man).

longDescription.Effect:
Increases the size and doubles the damage of blue spiders and blue flies.
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.Notes:
This item does not affect Fly familiars.
 The effect also applies to locusts.
No effect on flies made passive by Skatole.
longDescription.Interactions: Sissy Longlegs: Increases familiar's size.
longDescription.Trivia: Hive mind is the concept of a large number of beings acting in the interest of the survival of the group as a whole, with little to no individuality.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns two items instead of one after defeating a boss. Only one item can be chosen; the other disappears.
  The extra item is selected from the normal Boss Item Pool , regardless of the boss.
longDescription.Notes:
Two items are spawned after clearing Boss Rush.
Has no effect on the Krampus fight.

longDescription.Effect: All bombs become 1+1 bomb pickups
longDescription.Interactions: Humbling Bundle: No effect.
longDescription.Trivia: "B.O.G.O." is an acronym for the term "Buy One, Get One (Free)".

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a random card.
Allows Isaac to carry two cards or runes at once. Cycle through cards by pressing the Control key (PC), R2 (PlayStation), RT (Xbox), or ZR (Switch, 3DS).
Replaces all pills with cards except the pill dropped by Caffeine Pill. Pills already on the ground will be converted to cards or runes upon picking up Starter Deck.
longDescription.Notes: When picking up Starter Deck in a shop that has a pill for purchase, the pill can still be purchased and used. If the pill is dropped, it will be turned into a card.
longDescription.Interactions:
Acid Baby: Spawns cards or runes instead of pills. Using cards or runes will not trigger the room-wide poisoning effect.
Little Baggy: Overrides the effect of Little Baggy (switch from receiving only pills to only cards). Picking up Little Baggy while already holding Starter Deck will turn any held cards or runes into pills for one time.
Mom's Bottle of Pills: Gives a card instead of a pill, essentially becoming equivalent to a Deck of Cards.
longDescription.Trivia:
The Starter Deck will paint a five color pentagram on Isaac's head, which is a reference to the Magic: The Gathering logo.
This item is used in It's in the Cards (challenge #14).

longDescription.Effect:
Allows Isaac to carry two pills. Tap the Drop button to cycle through the two pills.
Spawns a random pill.
Changes all card and rune drops into pills.
  Any Tarot card or rune held when picking this item up will change into a pill. 
  Dice Shard counts as a card and will be converted.
longDescription.Interactions:
Crystal Ball: Generates pills instead of cards upon use.
Deck of Cards: Generates pills instead of cards upon use, similar to Mom's Bottle of Pills.
PHD/Virgo: Most negative pills will be converted to their positive counterparts.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants one full red heart container.
+1 Luck.

longDescription.Notes:
The damage bonus is unaffected by both positive and negative damage multipliers.
Azazel has a chance to fire a beam with the damage bonus. Range is unaffected.
Cain has a 50% chance of firing a shot with the effects of Blood Clot whenever he fires, since he can only shoot from his right eye.
The Forgotten has a chance for Blood Clot effects to apply to his melee or ranged attack. When Blood Clot effects are applied the bone will turn red. When throwing the bone club, range seems to be unaffected.
Every other set of tears Keeper fires has the Blood Clot effect.
Chemical Peel applies to the same eye and the effects stack.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Laser beams have a chance to have the Blood Clot effect. Has no effect on range.
Kidney Stone: Half of the tears in the tear barrage have Blood Clot effect but the stone is unaffected.
The Ludovico Technique: Tear flashes between red and white, with red dealing greater damage.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Blood Clot.
Technology 2: Every tear fired has Blood Clot applied to it, but the laser is unaffected.
Tech X: Overrides Blood Clot.
Varicose Veins: Blood Clot has no effect.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.5 tears up
+0.2 shot speed up

Isaac gains +5 bombs on pickup.
Placed bombs deal 1 point of damage to enemies on contact and will leave behind fire that damages enemies on contact upon exploding.
  Fire from a Hot Bomb doesn't damage Isaac.
longDescription.Notes:
If a Hopper touches a Hot Bomb, it will become a Flaming Hopper.
The contact damage does not scale with Isaac's damage, and is completely removed if Isaac acquires another bomb item that overrides the flaming bomb graphic such as Mr. Mega or Glitter Bombs.
 Big Horn will throw Hot Bombs at Isaac that deal contact damage. Orange champion Little Horn summons bombs that are identical in function, but given the Troll Bomb sprite and colored orange.
longDescription.Interactions:
Dr. Fetus/Epic Fetus: Bombs/missiles are not affected by Hot Bombs.
  Bombs/missiles are affected by Hot Bombs.
Ipecac: Shots are not affected.

longDescription.Effect:
Tears inflict Burn to enemies.
Tears have a chance to explode on impact with an enemy, leaving behind fire.
  Explosions deal Isaac's current tear damage, in addition to the tear's hit. 
  The fires deal 22 damage per tick.
   Isaac cannot take damage from the flame, but he will take damage from the explosion.
 Isaac gives a wide glow lighting up dark areas, such as those under the effects of the Curse of Darkness or the Dark One's attacks.
longDescription.Notes:
The explosion effect chance depends on the luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 13 luck.
An exploding tear does not actually set either the hit enemy or anything in the blast range on fire.
Explosive and burning damage is equal to Isaac's current damage stat.
The flame will transform Hoppers into Flaming Hoppers.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Adds burn damage to the beam, but will not cause explosions.
The Ludovico Technique: Tears retain the ability to ignite enemies and explode. Tears will respawn at Isaac's location after explosion.
Mom's Knife: Overrides the explosion chance, but the knife can still set enemies on fire.
Mysterious Liquid: Overrides the explosion chance, but tears can still set enemies on fire.
  When the Fire Mind tear explodes, a much larger pool of creep is left behind.
Sinus Infection: Tears will still stick to enemies, but lose the booger appearance. The booger tears will not constantly burn the enemy they are stuck to.
Technology/Technology 2/Tech.5/Tech X/Technology Zero: Adds burn damage to the beam, but will not cause explosions.
Trisagion: Beams can burn enemies but won't cause explosions.

longDescription.Effect:
Randomizes passive items and attributes on pickup and at the start of every floor.
  Stats gain a random flat modifier. These modifiers do not stack between levels and are instead rerolled every time.
   Speed and maximum speed -0.2, 0 or +0.2. Maximum speed may never exceed 2.0. 
   Range -0.5, 0 or +0.5. 
   Tears -0.5, 0 or +0.5. 
   Shot speed -0.2, 0 or +0.2. 
   Damage -1, 0 or +1. 
   Luck -1, 0 or +1. 
  Does not affect trinkets , cards , pills , Pretty Flies , The Polaroid / The Negative , Key Piece 1 / Key Piece 2 , or active items. 
  Can cause but does not remove transformations . 
  Missing No. cannot be re-rolled with D4 or D100 after being picked up.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is a reference to the infamous Missing No. glitch occuring in the first Pokmon games. The glitch would often corrupt save files, and therefore randomize various parts of the game as it would use the incomplete index values attributed to entities not included in the final release of the game. Isaac's appearance when affected by Missing No. is based on this glitch which could cause the player's sprite to become scrambled.
The item also resembles the painting "Composition with Red, Yellow, and Blue" by Dutch painter Piet Mondrian.
The background color for the Missing No. achievement has the same color as all the challenge unlocks. This implies that Missing No. was originally intended to be unlocked via a challenge. (Or, perhaps, it was intended to be looked at as an error.)

longDescription.Effect:
+1 Damage.
Adds a chance to shoot fear tears, causing enemies to run away from Isaac.
longDescription.Notes:
Fear tear effect depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 20 Luck.
  This makes Dark Matter significantly better at inflicting fear than Abaddon or Mom's Perfume .
longDescription.Interactions:
Haemolacria: Tear appearance stays the same; only the main tear can cause fear.
Lachryphagy: If a fear tear is fed, all burst tears cause fear. If a normal tear is fed, the burst tears cannot cause fear.
The Ludovico Technique: Tear occasionally changes appearance to Dark Matter tears and causes fear.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #4 (Darkness Falls).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants immunity to floor curses.
  Will immediately remove any curses on the current floor.
Grants a black heart upon pickup.
Increases chance for a Devil / Angel room door to open when a floor Boss is killed by 15%.
longDescription.Notes:
Picking up this item during the Cursed! challenge will not remove the Curse of the Cursed.
Picking up this item during the Pitch Black challenge will not remove the Curse of Darkness or the Curse of the Unknown.
Picking up this item while under the effect of an Amnesia pill will remove the effect of the pill. However, the item does not negate the effects of Amnesia pills used after picking up this item.

longDescription.Effect:
Doubles Isaac's Damage stat.
Isaac's tears become larger and do more damage, but shrink and do less damage the farther they travel.
longDescription.Notes:
Effective range of Isaac's tears now also depends on damage, as they can shrink out of existence before their air time runs out.
Tear size increasing items also increase the maximum distance before disappearance, but the damage dealt can go below original at the extreme.
The item has the opposite effect of the item A Lump of Coal, which makes Isaac deal more damage from farther away.
Does not affect Azazel's short-ranged Brimstone unless the range stat is extremely high.
longDescription.Interactions:
Athame/Maw of the Void: The ring is much larger and deals 1.5x damage.
  The ring deals normal damage.
Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/The Parasite: Tears will often disappear before they can burst. Tears created from bursts will also shrink, but due to their already low range, the difference may not be noticeable.
Flat Stone: At base range and tear size, tears will bounce twice against the floor and then disappear.
Ipecac: Tears almost disappear completely but are still able to do massive damage.
Lachryphagy: Tears disappear too quickly to be fed.
The Ludovico Technique: The closer the tear floats to Isaac, the larger it is. The farther away, the smaller it becomes.
Monstro's Lung/Lead Pencil: Tears will disappear at different distances depending on how big they were when fired.
My Reflection: Tears disappear before they can return to Isaac.
Pop!: Tears will disappear extremely quickly after being fired.
Soy Milk: Very poor combination. Tears disappear nearly instantly in front of Isaac, decreasing his range and damage to nearly nothing.
longDescription.Trivia: Eye proptosis is a condition resulting in forward displacement and entrapment of the eye from behind by the eyelids. The condition is also known as eye dislocation and eye luxation.

Missing_Page_2.shortDescription: Evil up. Your enemies will pay!

longDescription.Effect:
Grants 1 black heart.
Activates The Necronomicon effect upon taking damage if Isaac's total health (red hearts, soul hearts, and black hearts) is at one or fewer hearts afterwards.
longDescription.Trivia:
The item is a reference to the Necronomicon, a fictional grimoire appearing in the works of horror writer H.P. Lovecraft.
  This is acknowledged in game by The Necronomicon , A Missing Page , and Missing Page 2 all having a similar effect.

longDescription.Effect:
-0.3 speed and maximum speed down.
When in a room with enemies, Isaac gradually gains speed at a rate of +0.065 per tick. This speed boost will be able to go past the lowered maximum.
Once Isaac's speed reaches 2.0, he gains the My Little Unicorn effect for 5 seconds, becoming invulnerable, and loses the speed bonus from Taurus afterwards.
longDescription.Notes:
Isaac slowly gains a red tint that becomes more intense as he gains speed.
The speed boost and invulnerability effect activate only once per room.
The higher Isaac's base speed, the quicker the effect activates. It can activate immediately upon entering a room if his base speed is high enough.
The item doesn't trigger in rooms that don't have enemies when first entered. This includes Challenge Rooms and the Boss Rush room.
If Isaac gets teleported out of the room by any source, the My Little Unicorn Effect won't trigger if the room is re-entered.
Bombs can be placed during the charge.
longDescription.Interactions:
Libra: Isaac's damage and range increases as speed increases. However, if Isaac's base speed is not high enough, the invincibility never activates.
The Ludovico Technique: Isaac cannot control the tear while invincible, but any enemies touching it will still take damage from it.
longDescription.Trivia: If you are invincible as a result of having this item when you touch the chest after the ??? fight, the music during the credits will still be sped up. The music during Ending 14 and its "The End" screen will play as normal, however (This has not been confirmed for other endings or items that cause music to distort).

longDescription.Effect:
+0.25 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).
Running into enemies while at a high speed will deal 18 points of damage. Does not prevent contact damage.
  At least about 0.8 speed is required to be able to move quickly enough.

Grants three soul hearts.
Upon taking damage, grants The Wafer effect of damage reduction for the current room.

Isaac can break obstacles by walking into them.
Increases Isaac's size.
 This item belongs to the Stompy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Stompy.
longDescription.Notes:
Walking into bomb rocks will cause them to explode.
Mushrooms may hurt Isaac with a poison cloud if walked into.
Polyps may hurt Isaac with blood shots or red creep if walked into.
Flight does not prevent the effect from occurring.
Holes in the ground can be filled if Isaac walks into adjacent rocks from the right direction, similar to bombs.
TNT Barrels will not be destroyed or explode on contact.
Allows Isaac to walk over and destroy red poop without taking damage. Isaac will still take damage if he is standing on it when it reforms.
Walking into an Angel Statue in the Angel Room will trigger the boss fight, and Isaac will take damage as the Angel spawns on top of him.
 Nullifies effects of One Makes You Small pills, One Makes You Larger pills, and other items which decrease size, such as Caffeine Pill andBinky.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants a chance to trigger the Book of Shadows effect upon taking damage, creating a shield that nullifies all types of damage for 7 seconds.
  The activation chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% with 10 Luck.
Converts all stat down pills into stat up pills, "Bad Trip" into "Balls of Steel" and "Amnesia" into "I Can See Forever", like PHD does, but does not identify any pill.
longDescription.Notes:
The shield negates health loss from Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars.
Does not prevent heart container loss from Devil Room deals.
The following pill types are neutral and do not have a "good" equivalent.
  "Hematemesis". 
  "Explosive Diarrhea". 
  "I found pills". 
  "Paralysis". 
  "R U A Wizard". 
  "Telepills".
Bad pills already obtained/dropped will be converted to their "good" counterpart too.
As bad pills will turn into good pills, it is possible for two different colored pills to have the same effect.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants 6 Coins, 6 Bombs and 6 Keys.
Continually balances Isaac's primary attributes - damage, range, tears, and speed (has no effect on luck, tear height, or shot speed). This effect is NOT one time only - Libra will rebalance Isaac's attributes whenever they are changed by an item, effect, etc. including temporary effects such as the The Book of Belial.
longDescription.Notes:
The balancing is based on Isaac as the character himself, and he gains no bonuses or penalties to any stat from simply having Libra on its own.
The balancing formula for Libra values damage a little lower than other stats. This means a standard damage up effect will actually grant less damage than a standard speed up or range up effect will.
Stats are capped before Libra's balancing is applied. This means that if speed is maxed out (2.0) already, a Speed Up effect will not increase any stats at all.
Since tear height is not involved in the calculations, items such as Mini Mush or Kidney Stone that increase tear height but lower range are mostly detrimental.
longDescription.Interactions:
Blood Clot / Chemical Peel: The stat rebalancing doesn't affect the modified tears.
D8: D8's stat changes depend on which stats end up with which multipliers and their base values. Range has high weight and is uncapped, and thus can result in a massive boost if it scores a high multiplier. Damage is also uncapped but, on the other hand, has low weight.
Taurus: Isaac's damage and range increases as speed increases. However, if Isaac's base speed is not high enough, the invincibility never activates.
longDescription.Trivia:
The symbol of the scales is based on the Scales of Justice held by Themis, the Greek personification of divine law and custom.
Libra gives 6 bombs, 6 keys, and 6 coins, a potential reference to the Number of the Beast (666).

longDescription.Effect:
Grants poison tears, dealing damage over time when inflicted.
The poison randomly hits either 2 or 3 times, dealing a total of 4 or 6 damage.
  The poison hits twice, dealing a total of double Isaac's damage.
longDescription.Notes: This item is strictly a superior version of The Common Cold.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.2 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).
Grants piercing tears.
longDescription.Interactions:
8 Inch Nails: Knockback overridden by Sagittarius.
Blister: Overridden by Sagittarius.
Pisces: Knockback overridden by Sagittarius.

longDescription.Effect:
+1 health
+0.5 damage
+0.1 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0)
+1.5 range
+1 coin
+1 bomb
+1 key
-1 tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.

A trail of blue creep follows behind Isaac and damages enemies that walk over it.
  The creep deals 2 damage per tick or 6 damage per second.
longDescription.Trivia: The pickup quote "Trail of Tears" is a common phrase referencing the U.S. Indian Removal Act of 1830.

longDescription.Effect:
Increases tear knockback.
  If the player has piercing tears , the knockback effect is reduced.
Slightly increases tear size.
-1 tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.
longDescription.Interactions:
Blister: Overrides Pisces.
Brimstone: The beam gains knockback.
Dr. Fetus / Epic Fetus / Ipecac: Explosions also gain increased knockback.
Mom's Knife: The knife gains knockback.
Cupid's Arrow/Death's Touch/Dead Onion/Sagittarius: Tears gain knockback.
Technology/Technology 2/Tech X: The lasers gain knockback.
  Technology 2's constant laser has such strong knockback, it can pin enemies to walls.
Trisagion: Adds knockback to blasts, which can not only significantly repel enemies when used correctly, it can deal a high amount of damage to enemies unable to escape the knockback.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item, like the other Zodiac items, is a reference to Zodiac signs.
Isaac appears to be covered in scales, a reference to Pisces being represented by twin fish.

longDescription.Effect:
2x damage multiplier.
-0.5 shot speed.
0.5x tears / 2x tear delay multiplier. (The player's tear value will always be halved.)
longDescription.Notes: Eve's Mascara is DPS neutral, though often the reduction of shot speed is a downgrade. Combos very well with any item that scales with damage but not with fire rate, such as Rotten Baby or Fate's Reward.
longDescription.Interactions:
Diplopia: The damage and tear multipliers do not stack. The shot speed decrease does stack.
Dr. Fetus/Ipecac: Shots travel a very short distance so having Host Hat or Pyromaniac is strongly recommended.
The Ludovico Technique: Not recommended. Tear travels very slowly, making it hard to kill mobile enemies.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants an extra life.
Upon death, Isaac resurrects as Black Judas.
  Black Judas has a damage multiplier of 2.00 and a base speed of 1.1.
longDescription.Notes:
Beating bosses as Black Judas will give Completion Marks for Judas and will unlock the associated items and achievements.
Because Black Judas counts as a unique character, this means that all character-specific qualities are replaced with those of Black Judas's upon death.
