Circle of Protection's in-game icon may be based on the band A Perfect Circle's logo. The pickup quote is also similar to the lyrics of their song Pet.

longDescription.Effect:
All bomb, coin, key, card, rune, pill, and battery pickups have a 33% chance to be replaced with sacks.
  This includes pickups spawned by anything: chests, slot machines, special shopkeepers, etc.
Spawns a sack upon pickup.
longDescription.Notes:
Shopkeepers have a chance to drop this item when destroyed.
Troll bombs can also be replaced with sacks.
Chests in challenge rooms can be replaced with sacks. If this happens, enemies will begin spawning when the sack is touched.
 Sacks on each floor tend to have the same contents, which can be taken advantage of if cards are involved. This no longer happens as of Booster Pack #5.

longDescription.Effect:
A cone of light shines from Isaac's chest that slows all enemies and enemy shots.
  The light will face the direction Isaac is moving. 
  The light doesn't affect bosses , but it will slow their shots. 
  The slow effect will disappear from enemies when the light stops shining on them, but shots will remain slowed.
Removes Curse of Darkness for the current floor, but does not provide immunity.
longDescription.Notes:
The light only needs to touch a shot to slow it permanently.
  Doing a quick circular motion is effective to slow surrounding enemy shots, especially while fighting Hush .
longDescription.Trivia: This item is part of a set of bedtime-themed items, includingBinky, Blanket,Mr. Dolly, andPJs.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants four soul hearts.
Restores all health.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is part of a set of bedtime-themed items, includingBinky, Blanket,Mr. Dolly, andNight Light.

longDescription.Effect:
Enemies have a 5% chance to drop a penny when hit with Isaac's tears.
Turns Isaac's tears into coins (cosmetic effect).
longDescription.Notes:
Hitting the front side of enemies such as the Knight will still produce coins, even though the enemy does not sustain any damage. This can be exploited to produce an infinite amount of coins from a single enemy. However this won't work with defensive Hosts.
Enemies that spawn other enemies, globins, or enemies that regain health can also be farmed for infinite money.
Head of the Keeper does not work with The Forgotten but will work with The Soul.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Head of the Keeper.
  Azazel 's short ranged Brimstone also overrides Head of the Keeper.
Death's Touch: Tears retain Death's Touch's cosmetic effect (scythes) but both items are fully active.
Sulfuric Acid: Tears retain Head of the Keeper's cosmetic effect but both items are fully active. Which tears are acidic can no longer be visually identified.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Head of the Keeper.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Head of the Keeper.
Euthanasia: Main tears can cause enemies to drop pennies; however, burst tears do not.
Haemolacria: Only the main tear retains the effect of Head of the Keeper.
Ipecac: Because Ipecac's high damage will quickly kill enemies, and because enemies will often be hit with explosions rather than tears themselves, coins will not drop as frequently.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Head of the Keeper.
Technology: Overrides Head of the Keeper.
Tech X: Overrides Head of the Keeper.
Trisagion: Overrides Head of the Keeper. Coin debris will still appear after beams dissipate.
longDescription.Trivia:
The item resembles Ultra Greed's head.
The coins fired are the same as Ultra Greed's coin projectiles.
When picked up as Keeper, he will look similar to the Greed Gaper.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants 5 bombs.
Isaac's bombs have a chance to spawn a pickup or trinket when they explode.
Isaac's bombs have a chance to charm random enemies in the room when they explode.
longDescription.Notes:
Picking up a gold bomb, Dr. Fetus, or Epic Fetus with Glitter Bombs allows infinite pickup generation.
  In Greed Mode , infinite pickup generation is still possible, but excludes coins, presumably to prevent the player from filling the Greed Machine in a single run. However, this can be worked around if Isaac has the Swallowed Penny or Piggy Bank , since it does still produce health.
The exploding shots from Ipecac do not drop pickups.
longDescription.Trivia: The act of glitter bombing refers to showering individuals with containers of glitter.

longDescription.Effect:
Upon taking damage, inflicts fear on all enemies in the room and spawns a dark friendly Charger.
  The Chargers deal 5 damage per hit to enemies. 
  Isaac keeps the chargers when transitioning between rooms.
longDescription.Notes:
If this item is triggered in the Flooded Caves, there is a chance that the black charger will be replaced by a Drowned Charger. The summoned Drowned Charger will behave like normal black chargers, and upon death will explode into 4 blood shots that do not damage the player.
Shadows of incoming attacks from above will be harder to see, as they're covered by the item's shadow initially.
This item can only spawn a maximum of 5 chargers.
longDescription.Interactions:
BFFS!: No effect.
Box of Friends: No effect.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item's pickup quote is a reference to the song Me And My Shadow.
This item's sprite looks similar to an upside down version of Judas' Shadow.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants one soul heart.
+0.7 Tears up.
Decreases Isaac's size.
Increases the pitch of Isaac's voice.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is part of a set of bedtime-themed items, including Blanket, Mr. Dolly, Night Light, and PJs.

longDescription.Effect:
-0.2 speed and maximum speed
-15 range
+2.0 tear height.
  The increased tear height and decreased range results in overall slightly less firing distance.
Occasionally, firing tears will cause Isaac to charge an attack with his head pulsating with a red color. After the attack has charged up, the fire button can be released to fire a kidney stone that deals extra damage while piercing enemies and walls, and to fire a barrage of tears afterwards.
  This effect occurs approximately every 25 seconds. 
  Isaac won't be able to fire tears normally until the kidney stone has been fired. 
  The kidney stone has approximately twice the range of normal tears. 
  The tears fired afterwards are a bit inaccurate and can be fired slightly to either side. 
  The barrage will continue for its full length between Rooms , as will the state of charging the attack instead of firing tears.
When Isaac has half a heart left, the urine that appears underneath Isaac upon entering rooms will be changed to red.
longDescription.Notes:
Tints tears red. This is only a cosmetic change.
Incubus will still fire tears normally while retaining the barrage effect, making this a good item for Lilith.
  The barrage from the Incubus will be in a straight line instead of an inaccurate burst. 
  The kidney stone itself will come out of Lilith, not the Incubus follower, even though she cannot fire tears. The barrage of tears will still only come from the Incubus.
longDescription.Interactions:
Anti-Gravity: The stone will not hover and will travel regardless, otherwise behaves as expected.
Brimstone: No effect. Speed down still applies. Range down applies to Azazel's Brimstone, making it difficult to use at base range.
Dr. Fetus: Not recommended. Bombs have very low range, making self damage very likely.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Kidney Stone.
 The Forgotten: When in skeletal form, the Forgotten will fire the stone and swing his club rapidly instead of shooting.
Haemolacria: Overridden by Haemolacria. Only stat changes apply.
Jacob's Ladder: The tear barrage will spawn sparks as normal; however, the stone will only spawn sparks when hitting enemies.
Libra: The harsh speed and range down make Libra potentially a large stats down. Stats are increased during the barrage.
The Ludovico Technique: Overrides Kidney Stone. Tear becomes red (cosmetic change).
A Lump of Coal: The stone will not change appearance or grow bigger as it travels but it will increase in damage as it travels.
Marked: Occasionally, Isaac will stop automatically firing, and an attack key must be held to release the kidney stone and continue firing.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Kidney Stone.
Monstro's Lung: Overrides Kidney Stone.
Soy Milk: Stone will be reduced to starting tear damage and is significantly smaller.
Technology: Overrides Kidney Stone.
Tech X: Overrides Kidney Stone.
Tiny Planet: The stone and barrage of tears that follow orbit the character.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is a reference to the kidney stone Matt Kap had removed in 2015, hence "Matt's kidney stone"
  Matt Kap was a pixel artist on The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth and its expansions.

longDescription.Effect:
When at exactly 1 red heart, some of Isaac's stats are increased.
  +1.5 range 
  +1 tear height 
  +0.7 tears 
  +0.2 shot speed
The effect is lost any time Isaac gains or loses red hearts.
longDescription.Notes:
This item pairs well with Eve, since she starts with Whore of Babylon, and is the only character that can gain Whore of Babylon's effect at 1 heart.
This item has no effect on Blue Baby, The Lost, or The Soul since they cannot gain red hearts.
This item only affects Keeper when he has only one coin heart.
This item only affects The Forgotten when he has one full bone heart.
The effect does not stack with multiple Dark Prince's Crowns.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is the first Afterbirth+ item by ID number.
This is the demonic counterpart of theCrown of Light.
While this item is activated, it is colored red; if not, it's colored gray (Similar to the Crown of Light).

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a chance to fire razor blades that deal quadruple Isaac's tear damage.
  The chance to fire a razor blade depends on the luck stat. At base luck (0), it is a 6.66% chance, and goes up to 100% at 14 luck.
+0.3 tears.
longDescription.Interactions: Tech X: Overrides Apple!.
longDescription.Trivia:
Both the item itself and the description is a reflection of one of Isaac's nightmares between floors that involves him finding a razor blade inside a piece of candy.
The item and pickup quote are a reference to the urban legend of giving away candies with razor blades hidden inside of them as a way of harming people.

longDescription.Effect:
After every 15 tears fired, Isaac will fire a low range Monstro's Lung-like barrage.
  Tears in the barrage deal double damage.
Tears will fire only from Isaac's right eye.
longDescription.Notes:
Lead Pencil gives non-Cain characters the same special properties that he has when it comes to one-eye items like Blood Clot.
Tears fired from items that cause multiple tears to be fired at once e.g. 20/20, Monstro's Lung, etc. are counted.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Lead Pencil.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Lead Pencil.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Lead Pencil.
Lilith: No effect, as Lilith is inherently Blindfolded.
Loki's Horns: Lead Pencil can fire in any of the cardinal directions if it fires at the same time as Loki's Horns.
The Ludovico Technique: The tear blinks red, but the effect is entirely cosmetic.
Incubus: Fires red tears like Blood Clot with Cain, but without increased damage.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Lead Pencil.
Technology: Overrides Lead Pencil.
Technology 2: Overrides Lead Pencil and disables normal tears entirely, even if not playing as Cain.
Tech X: Overrides Lead Pencil.
Tiny Planet: The burst follows Tiny Planet's circular trajectory with minimal range, hitting ground almost immediately.
longDescription.Trivia: Though the pencil is in Isaac's right eye, it blocks tears from firing out of his left eye.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.3 damage.
+0.1 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).
When entering a room connected to an undiscovered Secret Room or Super Secret Room, a howl sound effect will play.
A barking sound will play if there is an undiscovered Crawlspace in the room.
longDescription.Trivia: "Bark at the moon!" could be a reference to the song and album made by Ozzy Osbourne

longDescription.Effect:
While firing, creates an aura around Isaac that poisons any nearby enemies for 2 ticks.
  The poison may stack up to 6 ticks at a time.
Poison damage is equal to Isaac's damage stat.
longDescription.Interactions:
Azazel/Brimstone/Chocolate Milk/Mom's Knife/Monstro's Lung/Tech X: The green aura only activates when Isaacs' attack is charging.
Diplopia: No effect.
Epic Fetus/The Ludovico Technique/Marked: The green aura only activates when pressing the attack buttons.
The Forgotten: The green aura will activate when using melee and charging throw attack.
Lilith: No effect.
Mega Blast: The green aura will not activate while the beams are firing.
Sprinkler: Green aura will not activate if only the sprinkler is firing, and the sprinkler does not get its own green aura.
longDescription.Trivia: Halitosis is another term for bad breath.

longDescription.Effect:
Firing without a pause for 7.5 seconds creates a small brown cloud which damages enemies who walk through it.
  The damage is equal to Isaac's base tear damage, dealt roughly 5 times per second. 
  The clouds can be moved by shooting them. 
  The clouds only last for 15 seconds, meaning a maximum of two can be active at any given time. 
  Changing firing direction is allowed, but any pause in holding a fire button or taking damage resets the timer.

Adds a chance to drop a full red heart upon taking damage.
Adds a separate chance to gain the Anemic effect (+5 range, red creep trail) for the current room upon taking damage.
longDescription.Trivia: Blood and guts is a term for violence, typically in fiction.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants one soul heart.
Enemy shots that hit Isaac have a chance to be deflected back at the shooter as confusion-causing shots that use Isaac's tear damage and effects.
longDescription.Trivia:
The description of Metal Plate is a reference to Texas Chainsaw Massacre 2.[1]
Metal plates are sometimes surgically implanted in people's heads, typically to cover a hole in the skull.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a golden tear every 20 tears fired, which causes enemies to turn gold and freeze for a few seconds (similar to Midas' Touch) at the cost of one penny. Golden tears can still be fired if Isaac has no money.
  Unlike other tear effects, golden tears are fired alongside regular tears rather than replacing a regular tear. 
  With multi-shot abilities, whichever tear is the 20th since previous will produce the additional golden tear. 
  The golden tear deals 2x normal damage. 
  Enemies killed while golden will drop 1-4 pennies .
longDescription.Notes:
Tears fired from items that cause multiple tears to be fired at once, e.g. 20/20, Monstro's Lung etc., are counted.
  The gold tear is not duplicated by above said items.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Eye of Greed.
Diplopia: No effect.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Eye of Greed.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Eye of Greed.
Flat Stone: No effect.
Lost Contact: No effect.
The Ludovico Technique: Overrides Eye of Greed.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Eye of Greed.
Technology: Overrides Eye of Greed.
Tech X: Overrides Eye of Greed.

longDescription.Effect:
Drops a random card or rune on pickup.
Doubles the effect of most cards and runes.
longDescription.Notes:
Tarot Cloth's effect also applies to card effects used through Blank Card.
  As a result, using the Blank Card in conjunction with the Car Battery will cause the effect of the active card to quadruple, instead of double.
longDescription.Trivia: Tarot cloth is a reference to a particular type of cloth that covers tables during tarot card readings.

longDescription.Effect:
When Isaac gets hit, 10 tears are fired in a circle around him (similar to Tammy's Head).
  Tears spawned on hit have a +25 damage bonus.
When Isaac gets hit, has a chance to activate the Anemic effect for 2 seconds.
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: No effect. When Isaac gets damaged, only ten tears will be fired.
Anti-Gravity: No effect.
Chocolate Milk: Fires ten minimally charged tears. Damage of tears is reduced slightly.
Dr. Fetus: Taking damage releases 10 bombs around Isaac, which often leads to taking damage again.
Epic Fetus: Fires ten normal tears when taking damage.
The Ludovico Technique: No effect.
Marked: No effect.
Monstro's Lung: Fires ten red tears when taking damage. No other effects.
Soy Milk: Fires ten tiny tears when taking damage. Tear damage is only slightly reduced.
Tech X: No effect.
Tractor Beam: No effect.
longDescription.Trivia: Varicose veins is a medical condition where veins (typically on the extremities) become swollen and more clearly visible. They can also cause aching pain or discomfort.

longDescription.Effect:
Tears turn into bones, which shatter into 1-3 shards upon hitting an obstacle or enemy.
  Shards deal 50% of Isaac's normal tear damage. 
  Unlike The Parasite , there is no damage minimum on splitting, but the tears can also split only once.
+1.5 range.
+1.0 tear height.
longDescription.Interactions:
Anti-Gravity: Bone tears will hover until released but bone shards will travel normally.
Brimstone: Overrides Compound Fracture.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Compound Fracture.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Compound Fracture.
Flat Stone: Bone tears will bounce when they are fired, however, bone shards will not bounce when they travel.
Lachryphagy: Bone tears can be fed and will burst into split tears. Bone tears will burst into bone shards when hitting obstacles or enemies which can also be fed and burst into split tears and bone shards yet again. When bone shards are fed, they turn back into bone tears which can repeat this process again and again.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Compound Fracture.
Technology/Tech X: Overrides Compound Fracture.
Technology 2: The laser is not affected, but bone tears still shoot from Isaac's left eye.
Tractor Beam: Bone tears will not burst into bone shards when fired at obstacles, however, bone tears will burst into bone shards when fired at enemies.
Trisagion: Beams will only burst when hitting obstacles.
longDescription.Trivia: The item is a reference to a compound fracture, a medical condition where a bone breaks and is exposed through the skin.

longDescription.Effect:
Allows Isaac to carry two cards or pills (or a combination of both) at the same time.
Spawns one random card, rune, or pill.
longDescription.Interactions:
Deep Pockets: No additional effect.
Little Baggy: No additional effect.
Starter Deck: No additional effect.
longDescription.Trivia: Polydactyly is a birth defect affecting people born with extra amounts of fingers or toes than is normal.

longDescription.Effect:
+1.5 range
Drops a Lucky Penny
longDescription.Trivia:
The item may refer to Sobriety Coins, which are given to members of the Alcoholics Anonymous organisation to commemorate how long a member has remained sober.
  This is further supported in the item's The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls rendition , which closer resembles the most common design of Sobriety Coin.

longDescription.Effect: Grants one full red heart container.

Grants +1 Soul Heart.
Any damage dealt to Isaac has a chance to not deduct health.
  These include damage through tears, contact, explosions, cursed doors, Blood Donation Machines, and Demon Beggars. 
  Contact damage with enemies is difficult to avoid as the damage negation does not provide invincibility frames. 
  Isaac flashes briefly blue when damage is negated, similar to Infamy but with Breath of Life 's palette. The flash can occur even while invincible from taking a hit or using an invincibility effect.
longDescription.Trivia:
The item is a reference to the recurring Saturday Night Live sketch, The Coneheads.
It may also be a slight reference to the Youtuber/Streamer, Northernlion.

longDescription.Effect:
Drops a random trinket.
Grants a second trinket slot.
longDescription.Interactions: Mom's Purse: No effect; Isaac can still only carry two trinkets.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants a chance to fire a booger which sticks to an enemy and poisons it.
  Multiple boogers can stick to one enemy to deal extra damage. 
  The booger tears deal their damage once per second. 
  Each tick of poison deals damage equal to Isaac's tear damage. 
  The booger lasts for 60 seconds or until the enemy dies. 
  Boogers cannot pierce, and stick to the first enemy that they come in contact with.
longDescription.Notes:
The booger falls off the enemy after they die. If it hits another enemy before it touches the ground, it will stick to them and deal damage.
Jumping enemies or bosses like Monstro and Leapers and burrowing enemies like Round Worms and Lumps can get rid of the booger when they leap or burrow.
  Bosses like The Harbingers or Dark One , or enemies like Oob that have dash attacks do not lose the booger when they go off-screen.
The tear sticking effect is similar to Explosivo's.
Booger shots cannot impact bombs, making it potentially difficult to evade hostile bombs or push your own bombs along.
  Booger shots also cannot impact fireplaces.
Booger shots don't deal direct damage, and only deal damage through their poison.
The Nose Goblin trinket's effect is almost identical to Sinus Infection, with an added homing bonus.
Not affected by Luck.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Sinus Infection.
Compound Fracture/The Parasite: Booger tears will not split after killing enemies.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Sinus Infection.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Sinus Infection.
Holy Light: Holy light strikes do not activate on booger shots.
Ipecac: Overrides Sinus Infection. Booger tears will still appear, but will act identically to other Ipecac shots.
Jacob's Ladder: Lightning strikes do not activate on booger shots.
The Ludovico Technique: The large tear has a chance to stick to enemies. The tear cannot be controlled while it is stuck to an enemy, and cannot be removed until the enemy has died. Additionally, the tear does not inflict poison damage.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Sinus Infection.
Technology: Overrides Sinus Infection.
Tech X: Overrides Sinus Infection.
Trisagion: Overrides Sinus Infection.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a chance to shoot concussive tears, causing enemies to walk around randomly.
  The confusion caused by Glaucoma tears is effectively permanent for normal enemies, and very long duration compared to most status effects for bosses.
Makes the screen darker.
longDescription.Notes: Not affected by Luck.
longDescription.Trivia: Glaucomais a group of eye diseases which result in damage to theoptic nerveandvision loss.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a chance to fire an egg sack which spawns slowing creep. If an egg sack hits an enemy, a blue fly or blue spider is spawned.
Egg sack tears have considerably higher tear height and consequently, range.
longDescription.Notes:
Egg sacks will also spawn blue flies or spiders if they hit fireplaces or invincible enemies like Death's Head and Stoney.
The chance to fire an egg sack is affected by luck. It is 15% at base luck (0) but cannot reach 100% at high luck.
longDescription.Interactions:
Azazel: Parasitoid has no effect.
Brimstone: Overrides Parasitoid.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Parasitoid.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Parasitoid.
Haemolacria: Tears retain Haemolacria appearance and only the main tear can spawn flies or spiders when damaging enemies.
Ipecac: Only extra range applies on egg sack tears and they will not spawn flies or spiders.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Parasitoid.
Tech X: Overrides Parasitoid.
Technology: Overrides Parasitoid.
Trisagion: Overrides Parasitoid.
longDescription.Trivia: Parasitoid is a term for when insects' larvae live inside their hosts as a parasite before eventually killing the host.

longDescription.Effect:
+1.5 range.
+1.0 tear height.
Grants piercing tears.
After piercing one enemy, tears will deal double damage and home in on enemies.
longDescription.Notes: The piercing effect makes placed bombs, Troll Bombs, and Mega Troll Bombs unable to be pushed around by Isaac's tears.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Eye of Belial.
Compound Fracture/The Parasite/Cricket's Body: Tears that pass through enemies will become Belial tears and split into smaller Belial tears. Non-Belial split tears can also turn into Belial tears if they pass through enemies.
Diplopia: Only further increases range.
Dr. Fetus: Piercing effect applies, but homing and doubled damage do not.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Eye of Belial.
Haemolacria: IF the main tear pierces an enemy, it will turn into a Belial tear, and the burst tears retain the piercing effect and do double damage. If the main tear does not turn into a Belial tear, the burst tears will not be able to turn into Belial tears.
Ipecac: Overrides Eye of Belial.
The Ludovico Technique: Doubled damage does not apply if hitting the same enemy multiple times in a row. The controlled tear will continue to increase in size on every hit up to roughly the width of a single room, and the effect resets on changing rooms.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Eye of Belial.
Ouija Board: Eye of Belial tears lose their homing ability and fly off screen.
Technology: Overrides Eye of Belial.
Technology 2/Tech.5: The lasers are not affected by Eye of Belial; however, the tears apply the effect normally.
Tech X: Overrides Eye of Belial.
Trisagion: Overrides Eye of Belial.
longDescription.Trivia: Belial is a term from the Hebrew bible referring to the devil.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.3 damage.
Adds a chance to fire acidic tears that destroy destructibles and opens doors and secret rooms upon contact.
longDescription.Notes:
Cannot be used to bridge gaps with destructibles.
Does not open Stone Chests.
Can not destroy Stone Grimaces.
The chance to fire an acid tear does not increase with luck.
Acidic tears are able to destroy angel statues.
Acidic tears will not destroy projectiles.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Sulfuric Acid.
Continuum: Overrides Sulfuric Acid.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Sulfuric Acid except for stat effects that apply.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Sulfuric Acid except for stat effects that apply.
Ipecac: Overrides Sulfuric Acid except for stat effects that apply.
The Ludovico Technique: Overrides Sulfuric Acid.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Sulfuric Acid.
Rubber Cement: Acidic tears can no longer break objects and doors and just bounce.
Spectral Tears: Acidic tears will no longer be able to destroy obstacles or open secret rooms.
Technology: Lasers cannot break rocks even if non-spectral.
Tech X: Overrides Sulfuric Acid.
longDescription.Trivia: Sulfuric acid is a strong, corrosive acid, commonly used as a drain cleaner.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants 2 soul hearts.
Modifies drops from champion enemies depending on certain conditions. The priorities of the drops, in order, are as follows:
  Soul Hearts : When Isaac has no red heart containers and less than 2 soul hearts. 
  Full Red Hearts : While at 0.5 red hearts. 
  Keys : When Isaac has no keys. 
  Bombs : When Isaac has no Bombs. 
  Full Red Hearts : When Isaac has at least half a red heart container empty. 
  Coins : While Isaac has less than 15 pennies. 
  Keys : When Isaac has less than 5 keys. 
  Bombs : When Isaac has less than 5 bombs. 
  Trinkets : If Isaac has no trinkets and there are no trinkets on the ground in the room. 
  Soul Hearts : When Isaac has less than 6 total heart containers of any kind. 
  If none of the above conditions are true, champions will resume dropping their regular pickups.
longDescription.Notes: Because of how the item works in the priorities listed above, this item is useless for The Lost as he is always considered to be at half a soul heart, and all champion drops are replaced with soul hearts.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.3 tears up
Allows tears to be fired diagonally.
  With a keyboard or using buttons to fire with a controller, tears can be shot at 45-degree angles by holding two buttons. This is known as eight-directional firing. 
  With an analog controller, analog input is accepted, allowing full analog aiming in any direction.
longDescription.Notes: Enables full directional firing for keyboard and mouse users with the accessibility option EnableMouseControl enabled.
longDescription.Interactions:
Compound Fracture: When bone tears are fired diagonally, the bone shards will not always move diagonally.
Epic Fetus: No effect because missiles already can be fired in any direction.
Incubus: Incubus cannot fire in non-cardinal directions, only tears up applies.
The Ludovico Technique: No effect because the tear can already move in any direction.
Marked: Overridden by Marked.
Mom's Knife: Only the tears up applies, as Mom's Knife can already be fired at 45-degree angles without Analog Stick. However, if the player is using an analog controller, then Analog Stick is helpful as it allows full 360 degree movement.
Tiny Planet: Overriden by Tiny Planet.
Tractor Beam: Overriden by Tractor Beam.
longDescription.Trivia: The name and item sprite is a reference to a part of controllers used for moving characters and the camera in video games.

longDescription.Effect:
In each room, the first enemy killed will release a gas explosion and poison nearby enemies.
  Poisoned enemies will also release gas upon death, spreading the effect.
   Poisoned enemies do not need to die while the poison is still active to spread the effect.
longDescription.Notes:
The initial gas explosion deals 5 damage, and the poison deals Isaac's tear damage per tick, for 6 ticks.
The gas explosion and poison can damage friendly enemies.
longDescription.Interactions:
Dr. Fetus: Bomb damage does not apply to poison damage.
Epic Fetus: Missile damage does not apply to poison damage.
Ipecac: Ipecac only applies a 2x multiplier as opposed to +40 to poison damage.
Poison tears: No effect. Gas explosions will only be triggered by poison caused by Contagion
Second Hand: Poison duration is not affected.
longDescription.Trivia:
Its sprite is a recolor ofToxic Shock.
This item may be a reference to the movies Contagion and Outbreak, or the game Plague Inc..

longDescription.Effect:
Increases damage by 0.2 for each empty red heart container Isaac has.
  Half-full heart containers do not increase damage.
This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.
longDescription.Notes:
This item has no effect on The Lost and ??? because they can't have any red heart containers.
This item affects the Keeper; empty coin hearts increase damage.
As The Forgotten, empty bone hearts increase damage, but if the bone hearts are broken the damage buff is taken away.
longDescription.Trivia:
Prior to v1.06.0190, Adrenaline was named Adderline.
Adrenaline is a hormone produced by the body in situations of high stress that increases blood circulation, breathing, and other things in preparation of the natural flight or fight reflex.
Adrenaline causes characters to have an animation that makes them look like they are breathing rapidly.

longDescription.Effect:
Tears fire 1-2 sparks of electricity in random directions upon hitting an obstacle or enemy.
  Sparks deal half of the tear's damage (Isaacs' current damage stat). 
  Sparks behave like spectral homing lasers and will arc to hit enemies that are close enough, even striking multiple ones in a row. 
  Tears that hit the floor due to running out of range do not generate arcs.
longDescription.Interactions:
Azazel / Brimstone: Brimstone does not generate sparks.
Backstabber: Electric arcs cannot hit the enemies' backs for the extra damage and bleeding.
Compound Fracture / The Parasite: Although the scatter effect increases the amount of arcing, the split tears deal lesser damage and as such, less damage on their sparks.
Dr. Fetus / Epic Fetus: Bombs do not generate sparks.
Haemolacria: Only main tear can spawn sparks.
The Ludovico Technique: The Ludovico tear spawns a large number of sparks when in contact with an enemy, but not on obstacles.
Mom's Knife: The knife does not generate sparks.
Proptosis: Sparks will decrease in damage based on how much damage the tear has lost.
Rubber Cement: Tears will only spawn sparks when hitting enemies.
Tech X / Tech.5 / Technology / Technology 2: Lasers do not generate sparks.
Trisagion: Only spawns sparks when hitting obstacles.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item refers to high voltage traveling arcs, which are colloquially known as Jacob's ladders. It creates a small electric arc rising between two metal rods, as the item graphic represents.
  The name is a reference to The Book of Genesis from the Old Testament. In Genesis 28:10-19 Jacob rests on his journey and has a dream; in the dream he sees a ladder which serves as the connection between Heaven and Earth.

longDescription.Effect:
Shooting tears sometimes spawns a fire similar to Red Candle, damaging enemies and destroying shots it comes into contact with.
Use of pooping items (Re-Lax, The Poop, etc) causes fires to appear alongside the poop.
longDescription.Notes: The chance of spawning fire is not affected by luck.
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Will only spawn one fire.
Anti-Gravity: When holding down the fire button, when fire spawns it will be almost immediately put out by the clumps of tears.
Blood Clot: No effect.
Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/The Parasite: Fires cannot split.
Homing tears: Flames will not be homing.
Incubus: Will not spawn fire, making the item useless as Lilith.
Lachryphagy: Feeding tears will quickly douse the flames.
The Ludovico Technique: Fires created from Ghost Pepper will destroy the tear and cause it to respawn on Isaac.
A Lump of Coal: Affects normal tears but no effect on fire.
Pop!: Eyeballs tears quickly douse flames.
Proptosis: Flames will not lose damage or shrink as they travel.
Soy Milk: No effect on frequency or damage of flames.
Sprinkler: The sprinkler will not spawn flames.
longDescription.Trivia: In real life, "ghost pepper" is an alternate name for the bhut jolokia, which is arguably one of the world's hottest peppers.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a chance to fire needles which deal triple Isaac's tear damage.
  Needles will instantly kill regular enemies and cause them to burst into 10 more tears in all directions. 
  The chance to fire a needle depends on luck . At base luck (0), it is 3.33% and goes up to 100% at 15 luck.
longDescription.Notes:
The needle tears have the ability to kill enemies that are normally invincible, such as Peep's eyes, Death's Heads, and Stoneys.
The needle tears can kill Grimaces, allowing the player to permanently remove any obstacle in a room.
Possible needle tears in a burst from killing an enemy do not retain the instant kill and burst-causing capabilities, but still deal triple damage. This prevents chain reactions of bursts.
The tears in the burst are larger than normal, but do not have a damage bonus.
Unless piercing is obtained, Knights from the front will still block the needles.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides the tear burst, retains the chance for triple damage but does not change the appearance of the laser. Does not retain ability to kill normally unkillable enemies.
Compound Fracture: Bones will split up as normal, and upon touching an enemy, will burst into 10 bones which will all split. Bones and bone fragments have a chance to deal triple damage (bone fragments deal 50% of Isaac's tear damage by default), and they will instantly kill normal enemies.
Cricket's Body: Needle tears will split into 4 small needle tears upon hitting the ground or an enemy. Split tears produced have chance to deal triple damage, but will not cause tear bursts.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides the tear burst, retains the chance for triple damage but does not change the appearance of the bombs. Does not retain ability to kill normally unkillable enemies.
Epic Fetus: Overrides the tear burst, retains the chance for triple damage but does not change the appearance of the missiles. Does not retain ability to kill normally unkillable enemies.
Godhead: The tears retain all properties of Euthanasia, and while the aura has a chance to do triple damage, it cannot kill normally unkillable enemies, and will not cause a tear burst upon killing an enemy.
Ipecac: Overrides the tear burst, retains the chance for triple damage with large, explosive needles. Does not retain ability to kill normally unkillable enemies.
A Lump of Coal: When needles are fired, they don't seem to grow in size; however, they will increase in damage as they travel. Burst needles will increase in size and damage.
Little Horn: Some needle tears gain the piercing, instant kill effect and orange glow. When these tears pass through and kill an enemy, they do not burst into more tears.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Euthanasia.
The Parasite: Both regular tears and parasite split tears will cause enemies to burst into tears, with a chance to deal triple damage and kill normally unkillable enemies.
Tech.5: The laser has a chance to deal triple damage, will not burst into tears, and cannot kill normally unkillable enemies. The tears retain all properties of Euthanasia.
Tech X: Completely overrides Euthanasia. No triple damage, no tear burst. Cannot kill normally unkillable enemies.
Technology: Overrides the tear burst, retains the chance for triple damage but does not change the appearance of the laser. Does not retain ability to kill normally unkillable enemies.
Technology 2: The tears that Isaac fire retain all properties of Euthanasia, but the laser is unaffected.
Trisagion: Overrides the tear burst, retains the chance for triple damage but does not change the appearance of the holy beam. Does not retain ability to kill normally unkillable enemies.
longDescription.Trivia:
Euthanasia is the act of intentionally ending a person or animal's life in order to end their pain and suffering. It is usually carried out by an injection, hence why this item has the appearance of a needle.
Euthanasia is the only syringe item that points upwards; all of the other syringes point downwards.
Euthanasia and Experimental Treatment are the only 2 syringe items that need to be unlocked.

longDescription.Effect:
Upon entering a new room, Isaac will become camouflaged and all enemies become confused. The effect will last until the player presses a fire button.
  Bosses will not be confused when Isaac is camouflaged. 
  A co-op baby firing will also end the effect.
longDescription.Notes:
List of enemies that are completely unaffected by this item:
  Fistuloids 
  Pokys 
  Slides 
  Stone Grimaces 
  Stoneys
List of enemies partially affected by this item's effects:
  Tar Boys (visually confused, but will fire at your current location) 
  The Thing (visually confused, won't try to line up with you, but will spit damaging red creep when you're lining up with it) 
  Tube Worms (visually confused, but will fire at your current location) 
  Wall Creeps (visually confused, won't try to line up with you, but keep shooting projectiles/brimstone lasers) 
  Black Globin's Bodys (visually confused, but keep spawning spiders that are also confused) 
  Blind Creeps (visually confused, but keep shooting projectiles) 
  Fat Bats (visually confused, but keep shooting projectiles in random, ordinal directions) 
  Fattys & Pale Fattys (visually confused, but will fart/shoot projectiles, when you get close) 
  Hosts & Walking Hosts (visually confused, will pop up very often without actually shooting. Walking Hosts will move towards your direction) 
  Imps (visually confused, but will fire at your current location and also teleports around) 
  Lil' Haunts (visually confused, won't follow you, but will shoot at your current location) 
  Meatballs (visually confused, but will still spew fountains of short-range blood shots in all directions or a line of damaging red creep in a random direction) 
  Mom's Hand (visually confused, will land somewhere in the room (indicated by its shadow) and - if you get hit somehow - sends you back to the spawn room of the floor) 
  Mushrooms (visually confused, but will occasionally shoot red shots in either the cardinal or diagonal directions) 
  Nerve Ending 2 (visually confused, but will try to whip at you when you get too close) 
  Pooters & Super Pooters (visually confused, won't shoot, but will move slowly towards your direction)
Red & Purple Fireplaces are not affected by this item
While bosses are not confused, monsters spawned during boss fights are confused, as long as the effect lasts.
The item's effect can potentially cause FPS drops.
longDescription.Interactions: Brimstone: Charging ends the camo effect, and the effect doesn't happen when entering a room with a full charge.
longDescription.Trivia: The phrase Camo Kid is in reference to the CAM0 K1DD seed.

longDescription.Effect:
Whenever a Devil/Angel room spawns after defeating a boss, the other will also spawn.
  Upon entering one, the other one will disappear. 
  In rooms with only two accessible walls, only one of the two will spawn.
longDescription.Notes:
Even with Goat Head orEucharist both rooms will not stay open, and entering either of the rooms will make the other disappear.
If Duality was bought through a devil deal, it is still possible to get angel rooms as well as devil rooms.
Teleportation via a Joker card, a Red Chest or a Sacrifice Room before defeating the boss and choosing a door will follow the normal rules of Devil/Angel room generation, instead of a 50/50 chance.
  The room that was chosen this way will be the only one that opens once the boss is defeated. 
  Teleporting after choosing a door will always take you to the same room.
longDescription.Trivia: One of only four items to appear in both the Angel and Devil item pools, the others being7 Seals,Lil Delirium, andVoid.

longDescription.Effect:
An Angel Room Door will always spawn after every boss fight, excluding the first floor and floors after Chapter 4.
  Devil Rooms will no longer appear. 
  The spawned door will not disappear when leaving and re-entering the boss room.
longDescription.Notes: Eucharist applies two effects. Like Goat Head, it fixes the Devil Room Chance at 100%, which forces an Angel/Devil room to spawn whenever it can; it also fixes the Angel Room Chance at 100%, so the game always chooses an Angel Door over a Devil Door.
longDescription.Interactions: Goat Head: Overridden by Eucharist.
longDescription.Trivia: A eucharist is a Christian rite in which bread and wine are consecrated on an altar and consumed thereafter.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants an extra heart container for every 25 coins Isaac has, up to a maximum of 4 hearts at 99 coins.
  Dropping below the number of coins required for a heart container removes the heart container.
longDescription.Notes:
The extra heart container can exceed the maximum heart container limit of Keeper, allowing him to obtain more than 2 heart containers.
Depending on the character used, this item only affects red heart containers, soul hearts (???) or health coins (Keeper). It has no effect on The Lost.
The health container gain is not retroactive - picking it up at 99 coins will not grant 4 extra heart containers.
  However, picking it up at 99 coins and then dropping below 99 coins will lose a heart container, decreasing the feasibility of picking this item up the more coins you have.
   The player will die if they lose their last form of health as a result of Greed's Gullet. 
   If Keeper drops to under 2 health coins as a result of Greed's Gullet, or by any other means (devil deal, etc.), he is unable to use a HP Up to increase his health back to 2, and has to regain the lost coins to do so. 
  If Greed's Gullet is rerolled away after gaining health, the extra health will be preserved even if the player loses coins afterwards.
   However, if this happens with Keeper, his health will drop back to 2 health coins upon picking up an item, unless another Greed's Gullet is picked up.
Be careful when buying items from the Shop, as it can remove heart containers.
Enemies that drain Isaac's coins (such as Keepers, Hangers, Greed, or Super Greed) can remove heart containers.
longDescription.Interactions: Eye of Greed: Coins will be lost for every 20th tear fired, risking heart container loss if Isaac has more than 24 coins.

longDescription.Effect:
While firing, Isaac has a chance to fire an additional creep shot that deals double damage and leaves a trail of white creep that slows enemies.
  The chance is not affected by luck . 
  The creep shots are affected by range and shot speed , but don't take on any tear effects.
A creep shot will also be fired in a random direction when taking damage.
longDescription.Interactions:
20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Isaac will still fire one creep shot.
Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/The Parasite: Creep shots will not burst into split tears.
Incubus: Overrides Large Zit.
The Ludovico Technique: Movable tear behaves as normal. Isaac will occasionally fire a creep shot while moving the tear, and creep shots will only fire in cardinal or diagonal directions.

longDescription.Notes:
Little Horn's health bar appears at the bottom of the screen rather than the top.
The Gnawed Leaf can make the battle infinitely easier, as Little Horn will damage himself with his bombs over time. This will take a while, but none of his attacks can deal damage to Isaac when he stands still. Isaac can still fall into the pits and be transported around the screen, and will appear to suffer damage, but no actual loss of HP will occur if he is in statue form when he falls in.
The smoke balls that Little Horn spawns can appear in Closets in Caves and Flooded Caves. They also appear in a room with Little Horn in the Chest.
If Isaac has the Safety Scissors, he can acquire maximum bombs from the fight at fairly little risk, since the bombs Little Horn spawns will turn into bomb pickups and all his hole attacks are easy to dodge.
Little Horn's homing black ball is considered a monster. Killing it will activate items such as Charm of the Vampire, Infestation 2, andJar of Flies.
Occasionally, a pitfall that Little Horn summons will not vanish after defeating the boss. The pitfall is still active and can damage Isaac, even if it does not actively chase the player.
longDescription.Trivia:
Little Horn is referred to as male by Edmund.
Little Horn is the name of a boss from Super Meat Boy, one of Edmund McMillen's previous games.
Little Horn was created due to Edmund's love for Loki's design. (Despite him saying Little Horn is a Caves Boss, it is currently a Chapter 1 boss.)
The name "Little Horn" comes from the book of Daniel, where it refers to the Antichrist.
Upon defeat, Little Horn's eyes glow red, then he retreats back inside his hole. He does not explode into blood upon defeat.
 Little Horn appears to be a baby version of Big Horn.

longDescription.Effect:
Adds a chance to spawn a friendly enemy upon entering a room with enemies in it. The following enemies can spawn from Poke Go:
  Attack Fly 
  Pooter 
  Frowning Gaper 
  One Tooth 
  Fat Bat 
  Vis 
  Red Ghost
longDescription.Notes:
The effect is not activated upon entering the main room of Greed Mode.
Multiple friendly enemies can spawn at the same time.
For enemies that spawn other enemies, the spawned enemies will also be friendly.
longDescription.Trivia: The item is a reference to Pokmon. The item's name and appearance of a phone is a reference to Pokmon GO. "Gotta catch 'em all!" is a common phrase in the Pokmon series, and "A charmed (enemy) appears!" is a modified form of the phrase "A wild pokmon appears!" from the series.

longDescription.Effect:
When tears land on the "back" of enemies, they deal double damage and inflict bleeding.
  Bleeding enemies take damage equal to 10% of their maximum health every 5 seconds. 
  Bosses cannot be inflicted with bleeding, but will still take the extra damage.
longDescription.Trivia: This item might be a reference to Judas's betrayal of Jesus.

longDescription.Effect:
+0.1 flat damage.
Grants a soul heart.
Enemies may randomly become briefly charmed or feared.
Taking damage has a chance to spawn rainbow poop.
longDescription.Notes: None of the above effects are affected by Luck.
longDescription.Trivia:
Bozo is based on this Steam Workshop item by electoon.
This item is a reference to Bozo the Clown, a clown character whose broad popularity peaked in the 1960s.
The item's ability to inflict fear may be a reference to coulrophobia, the fear of clowns.
If you die with red heart containers and enemies destroy the rainbow poop in time, your hearts will fill up again, still leaving you dead.

longDescription.Effect:
Enemies, enemy shots, tears, and pickups will briefly freeze in place at random intervals.
  The frequency of the effect depends on Isaac's luck .
Has a 25% chance to double the room drop, similar to Contract From Below.
  Unlike the Contract, the Broken Modem cannot double chests , pills or cards .
longDescription.Interactions: Poke Go: The charmed enemies spawned by this item will also be affected by the modem.
longDescription.Trivia: Broken Modem is based on this Steam Workshop item by freeze.

longDescription.Effect:
+7 bombs.
Removes the delay between bomb placements, allowing them to be placed rapidly.
Grants an active item charge every 15 enemies killed.
longDescription.Trivia: Jumper Cables is based on this Steam Workshop item by Ashkait and Scayze.

longDescription.Effect:
Connects tears with electricity that damages enemies.
  The electricity's damage is equal to Isaac's damage. 
  Each of Isaac's tears can connect to other allied tears Including those of shooting familiars .
   The number of connections is limited by the number of Isaac's tears.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Technology Zero.
Continuum: Electricity that connects tears does not go through walls. Electricity does not reconnect when tears return.
Cain's Other Eye: Isaac's tears will connect with the tears from this item.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Technology Zero.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Technology Zero.
Haemolacria: Overrides Technology Zero.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Technology Zero.
Technology: Overrides Technology Zero.
Tech X: Overrides Technology Zero.
Trisagion: Overrides Technology Zero.
longDescription.Trivia: Technology Zero is based on this Steam Workshop item by Ashkait and Scayze.

longDescription.Effect:
Replaces Isaac's tears with eyeballs that can bounce off of each other.
Isaac's tears are no longer limited by range, and will instead dissipate when they stop moving or when hitting an enemy or obstacle.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overridden by Brimstone. Does not affect Azazel's Brimstone.
Dr. Fetus: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.
Epic Fetus: Overridden by Epic Fetus.
Flat Stone: Eyeball tears bounce repeatedly against the floor when they're about to disappear.
The Ludovico Technique: Overridden by The Ludovico Technique, though tear looks like an eyeball.
Mom's Knife: Overridden by Mom's Knife.
Tech X: Overridden by Tech X.
Technology: Overridden by Technology.
longDescription.Trivia: Pop! is based on this Steam Workshop item by Ashkait and Scayze, originally known as Bank Shot and themed about billiard balls.

longDescription.Effect:
Upon entering a room, a skull appears over an enemy's head.
  Killing the marked enemy will cause the skull to move to a different enemy. 
  If all enemies in the room are cleared in the order they are marked, Isaac gains a random reward as follows:
   A soul heart , a pill , a key , a bomb or a nickel . 
   +0.2 speed , +0.5 range , +0.5 tears , +0.2 shot speed , +1 flat damage or +1 luck . 
  If a non-marked enemy is killed, the skull will disappear and no bonuses will be granted for that room.
longDescription.Notes:
The marked enemies are chosen in the same order in a given room, starting from the top-left corner with enemies that are vulnerable at their spawn time. If new enemies are spawned via portals or on death, they are added to the end of the mark queue.
If a reward stat is chosen that is already at maximum, the sound effect and Isaac's thumbs up animation will play but there is no other effect.
Bosses may also be marked.
A room with no enemies but instead buttons to press to open the doors can also give a reward when cleared.
If a Portal is marked and despawns, if another enemy spawns or if an enemy dies and splits into multiple ones, no other enemy will be marked and the bonus is lost.
Enemies will not be marked in Challenge Rooms, Boss Rush or Greed Mode.
Angels from bombed Angel Statues will not be marked.
If the doors open automatically due to spending long enough in the room, any existing mark will disappear.
In Mom's boss fight, each of Mom's body parts (eyes, foot, and hands) is considered as a different enemy, and Isaac has to kill the foot in order to get the bonus.
longDescription.Trivia: Death's List is based on this Steam Workshop item by x Wyvern x, Ashkal and Merlo.

longDescription.Effect:
Tears are fired in an arc. Upon hitting the floor, an obstacle, or an enemy they burst into many smaller tears in all directions.
Tears down - (Delay * 2) + 10
Increases damage by about 31%.
  The scattered tears deal random damage that is around 50-80% of the main tear.
longDescription.Notes:
Higher shot speed lowers the arc of the main shot, whereas lower speed heightens it, resulting in very minor change in effective range.
  The split tears are affected normally by shot speed.
The tear height stat is entirely ignored for both the main shot and the split tears.
longDescription.Interactions:
Azazel: Haemolacria overrides Azazel's Brimstone.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Haemolacria, with increased damage and tear delay.
Flat Stone: At base range, the main tear bounces once, releasing burst tears which do not bounce, then bursts normally. At high range, the main tear can bounce multiple times.
Godhead: The main tear has the damaging aura but burst tears do not.
  Godhead + The Forgotten : The blood tears from the bone club have the damaging aura.
Holy Light: The main tear can be a holy tear and bursts normally in addition to the light beam. Split tears have an independent chance of being holy tears.
Kidney Stone: Overridden by Haemolacria. Only stat changes apply.
The Ludovico Technique: Overridden by Haemolacria.
Sinus Infection: If the main tear is a booger, it will get stuck and not burst on hitting an enemy, dealing its heightened damage. Split tears have an independent chance of being booger tears.
Tractor Beam: The main tear follows the beam, but the burst spreads normally.
longDescription.Trivia:
Haemolacria is based on this Steam Workshop item by HiHowAreYou, originally known as Water Balloon.
The item is a reference to Haemolacria, a rare condition that causes people to produce tears that are composed of blood.

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac's tears decelerate as they travel. Upon stopping or hitting an obstacle, they burst into 8 tears in all directions.
  Hitting an enemy will not cause them to burst.
Tears can be fired into other tears to feed them, increasing their damage and the damage of the burst tears.
  If one tear is fed 5 other tears, it will immediately burst. 
  The tears will have their damage added together, with the first consumed tear giving additional damage. 
  Tears in the burst will deal half the damage the main tear would have.
Tear bursting can also happen from sheer shot size. With sufficiently high damage or several tear-size increasing items, the tears will burst almost immediately after firing.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Lachryphagy does not affect regular Brimstone beams, but tears from other sources such as Isaac's Tears orFate's Reward will burst into 8 Brimstone beams.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Lachryphagy.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Lachryphagy.
Flat Stone: Overridden by Lachryphagy.
The Ludovico Technique: Overrides Lachryphagy.
Pop!: Tears behave erratically, with freshly fired tears usually behaving like Lachryphagy and burst tears like Pop!.
Tech X: Overrides Lachryphagy.
Technology: Overrides Lachryphagy.
Trisagion: Tears will split but cannot be grown by feeding tears.
longDescription.Trivia:
Lachryphagy is based on this Steam Workshop item by KittyK47, originally known as Hungry Tears.
The name of this item is a reference to the behavior of insects, drinking tears of other creatures.

longDescription.Effect:
Tears are replaced with piercing white blasts of light.
  Blasts deal 33% of regular tear damage, but can hit the same enemy multiple times. 
  Blasts do not knock back enemies.
longDescription.Notes:
Since the blasts can strike one enemy multiple times, low shot speed can be very beneficial whereas high shot speed may lower effective damage.
  Walking backwards while firing can allow tears to move slower, making it useful for increasing damage output.
longDescription.Interactions:
Azazel: Azazel's short range Brimstone overrides Trisagion.
Brimstone: Overrides Trisagion.
Cricket's Body/Compound Fracture/The Parasite: Split blasts are not generated on hitting enemies, only on obstacles and walls, as well as floors for Cricket's Body.
Dead Eye: Overridden by Trisagion.
Dr. Fetus: Overrides Trisagion.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Trisagion.
Eye of Belial: Overridden by Trisagion.
Flat Stone: Blasts continually disappear and reappear as they "bounce". The bounces deal 25% splash damage based on Isaac's base rating, but the blasts cannot do their damage while they're disappearing, leading to an overall reduced effeciency.
Holy Light: Overridden by Trisagion.
Jacob's Ladder: Electric arcs are not generated on hitting enemies, only on obstacles and walls.
Lachryphagy: The blasts will slow down and float like Lachryphagy tears and eventually burst, but can not consume each other.
A Lump of Coal: Nearly no effect; increases damage by around 5% when the hit is dealt by the tip of the blast.
  A Lump of Coal + My Reflection: As the beam is longer, the amount of extra damage at the tip can be up to around 50%.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Trisagion.
Multidimensional Baby: The baby cannot duplicate Trisagion blasts.
Parasitoid: Overridden by Trisagion.
Pop!: The blasts will slow down and float like Pop! tears, but will not bounce off each other.
Sinus Infection: Overridden by Trisagion.
Tech X: Overrides Trisagion.
Technology: Overrides Trisagion.
Technology Zero: Unless Isaac has shooting familiars, Technology Zero will not function. Familiars' tears will be connected to the blasts with electricity, however.
longDescription.Trivia:
Trisagion is based on this Steam Workshop item by x Wyvern x and TRPG, originally known as Lightshot.
The name is a reference to one of the oldest christian hymns.

longDescription.Effect:
Allows Isaac to hold two active items.
  Swap between active items by pressing the Control key (PC), R2 (PlayStation), RT (Xbox), or ZR (Nintendo).
longDescription.Notes:
The button to swap between active items is the same button used to swap between cards and pills.
Items in the secondary slot will recharge at the same rate as the primary item.
Items that grant temporary effects for the room, such as The Nail, may deactivate if switched with an item in the secondary slot.
The ? Card does not activate both active items.
While holding an active item that grants passive bonuses in the secondary slot, swapping the main slot item with a pedestal item may remove the bonuses. If this happens, you can swap the bonus-granting item to the pedestal and pick it up again to regain them.
The swap key must be pressed twice if playing as The Forgotten.
This item cannot be unlocked if the player encounters more than one Curse of the Labyrinth in Chapters 1-3, except by chance of finding Silver Dollar, Forget Me Now, or a 5-pip Dice Room.
  If one Curse of the Labyrinth is encountered, getting to the Blue Womb and entering the Shop there will unlock the Schoolbag.
longDescription.Interactions: My Little Unicorn / The Gamekid / Unicorn Stump: Switching items breaks the invincibility effect. This does not apply to other sources of invincibility.
longDescription.Trivia: Schoolbag is based on the Schoolbag item from the Binding of Isaac: Rebirth mod, Antibirth.

longDescription.Effect:
Heals one heart.
Grants one soul heart.
Upon entering a boss room, grants a shield that blocks one hit, then disappears.
longDescription.Notes:
If the shield is not broken before entering the next floor, it will disappear by itself.
To quickly unlock this item, keep restarting Greed mode to enter its curse room which occasionally contains a bed.
longDescription.Trivia:
Blanket is based on this Steam Workshop item by P.5000 and Ratlah, originally known as Security Blanket.
This item is part of a set of bedtime-themed items, including Binky, Mr. Dolly, Night Light, and PJs.
This item may be a reference to Linus van Pelt's famous blue security blanket, as seen in Peanuts.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns 3 random trinkets.
Taking damage has a small chance to swallow Isaac's currently held trinket, gaining its effect permanently.
longDescription.Notes: If activated while carrying two trinkets, both will be swallowed.
longDescription.Trivia: Marbles is based on this Steam Workshop item by Amethyst and Bustin Blotch.

longDescription.Effect:
Tears bounce off the floor.
  Whenever a tear bounces, it deals splash damage to all nearby enemies for 25% of Isaac's tear damage.
longDescription.Notes:
The bounces increase effective range without affecting the stat, usually around by one third.
Indirectly acquiring Rubber Cement through starting an Eden run or the D4 and D100 counts towards unlocking the item.
longDescription.Interactions:
Brimstone: Overrides Flat Stone.
Compound Fracture: No split tears on bounces.
Epic Fetus: Overrides Flat Stone.
Incubus: The effective range of Incubus' tears is roughly doubled, with a single bounce in the middle of the flight.
Jacob's Ladder: No electricity on bounces.
Kidney Stone: The stone fired by Kidney Stone doesn't bounce.
Lachryphagy: Overrides Flat Stone.
Technology: Overrides Flat Stone.
Tech X: Overrides Flat Stone.
Trisagion: Beams continually shrink and grow. Shrunken beams do roughly 75% of normal beams' damage.
longDescription.Trivia:
Flat Stone is based on this Steam Workshop item by Maddogs and Joe, originally known as Hydrophobicity.
It seems as though originally, the lasers produced by the Technology items (Technology, Technology 2, and Tech.5) and Brimstone were meant to synergize as seen in the Concept Art of Flat Stone.

longDescription.Effect:
Grants one bone heart.
Spawns three red heart pickups.

Creates a ring of light around Isaac that petrifies enemies in contact.
  Normal enemies stay permanently petrified as long as they are within the ring, whereas bosses get a standard petrification effect that stays even outside the ring but isn't permanent.

Spawns a Mysterious Paper.
  If Mysterious Paper has not yet been unlocked, it will not spawn.
Increases tears by 0.7.
Grants a bone heart.
longDescription.Trivia: The existence of this item suggests that the way Isaacs father left his Mom as seen in The Chests ending could have been through divorce.

longDescription.Effect:
Replaces all red hearts with 6 empty bone hearts.
  Upon losing a bone heart, Isaac fires bones in 8 directions and permanently gains a +0.5 tears up.
longDescription.Notes:
Picking this item up as The Lost or Keeper will give a one-time +0.5 tears up.
  Keeper will also gain 24 Blue Flies.
longDescription.Trivia: "Everything hurts" may be a reference to Melting from Nuclear Throne.

longDescription.Effect:
While held, causes one to two Mom's Foots to frequently come down and stomp around or on Isaac.
  This will happen randomly every few seconds and will persist as long as Isaac holds the item! 
  The stomps are functionally identical to explosions. 
  Using the item will stop the passive effect until entering another room. If used during the Boss Rush or in a Boss Challenge Room it will stop the feet for that wave of bosses only. 
  The effect will not happen in the Mom fight.
Disappears when picking up another active item and leaving the room.
One of two parts necessary to createMom's Shovel.
While held, removes the 20 minute time limit on the Boss Rush door (part of unlocking The Forgotten).
longDescription.Notes: Mom's foot will still attack Isaac even if he has the Punching Bag.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac around shooting normal tears that deal 3.5 damage.
 This item belongs to the Conjoined set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a three-faced version of himself.
longDescription.Notes: Brother Bobby is functionally identical to Sister Maggy.
longDescription.Trivia:
Brother Bobby, like ???, is a reference to Edmund McMillen's older games which are called Dead Baby Dressup.
This item is named after a baby doll that Edmund had as he was a child.
This item is used in challenges #19 (The Family Man) and #23 (Blue Bomber).
In the original game, the item Holy Water will turn one of your shooting familiars into Brother Bobby until the bottle is broken.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns two pretty fly familiars that block enemy shots.
  Pretty flies kill some fly enemies upon contact.
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.Notes: Orbital flies can also be obtained by other means, such as Slot Machines and Pretty Fly pills.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenge #6 (Solar System).
This item might be a reference to Halo of Flies, a song by Alice Cooper.
Halo of Flies shares its name with a level from Edmund's previous game Super Meat Boy.

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac gains an extra life.
  On resurrection, the mushroom that follows Isaac will disappear and Isaac will respawn in the previous room with all his previous red heart containers at full health. 
  If Isaac has no red heart containers, he'll respawn with 1/2 Soul Heart instead.
 This item belongs to the Fun Guy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking mushroom.
longDescription.Notes:
It is possible to collect more than one 1up!, resulting in multiple extra lives.
Resurrection from 1up! takes priority over all other resurrection items except Guppy's Collar.
??? will respawn with 3 soul hearts.
longDescription.Trivia: This is a reference to the Mario franchise, where collecting a green mushroom would give you an extra life.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a red attack fly that circles around Isaac, and deals 5 damage per tick or 75 damage per second on contact.
  The fly circles farther out than regular orbitals, but closer than Forever Alone .
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #6 (Solar System).

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and shoots tears that deal 3.5 damage.
  These tears appear red but have no special effects.
 This item belongs to the Conjoined set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a three-faced version of himself.
longDescription.Notes: Sister Maggy is functionally identical to Brother Bobby.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenge #19 (The Family Man).
In the original game, Sister Maggy deals 5 damage.

longDescription.Effect:
Multiple Cubes of meat can be collected in a single run:
  The first cube adds an orbital that blocks shots and deals 7 damage per tick or 105 damage per second to enemies on contact. 
  The second cube gives the orbital the ability to shoot tears that deal 3.5 damage. 
  The third cube stops being an orbital and hunts nearby enemies, dealing 3.5 damage twice per second. 
  The fourth cube increases size and damage of the Meat Boy, to 5.5 damage twice per second. 
  The fifth and subsequent cubes will start the cycle again.
longDescription.Notes:
Cube of Meat replaces one of the orbital flies when the player has 3 orbital flies. The fly returns after a third cube of meat is picked up.
If Monster Manual summons a Cube of Meat while the player has one already, it will raise the stage of Meat Boy only for the current room.
A Box of Friends will upgrade the Cube of Meat each time it is used, rather than creating another Cube of Meat.
The Guardian Angel orbital will increase the speed of the Cube of Meat if both are active at the same time.
A level 3 or 4 Meat Boy will deal significantly less damage than the orbital form, but is also much easier to use.
Potato Peeler can be used to get cubes by sacrificing a heart container.
longDescription.Interactions: Duct Tape: Familiar will stay in place relative to Isaac at levels 1 and 2. No effect at levels 3 and 4.
longDescription.Trivia:
The Cube Of Meat is a reference to Super Meat Boy, the main character of the game of the same name, developed by Edmund McMillen, creator of Binding of Isaac.
The pickup quote is a reference to the Pokmon series catchphrase "Gotta catch 'em all."

longDescription.Effect:
Sets Isaac's red heart containers to 1.
  Does not remove Soul Hearts or Black Hearts unless playing as ??? .
Grants 9 extra lives.
  Upon death, Isaac respawns with 1 red heart container .
The head of Guppy begins following Isaac like a familiar upon pickup, but doesn't actually do anything.
  When Isaac has lost all of the lives provided by this item, the dead cat familiar will disappear.
This item belongs to the Guppy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Guppy.
longDescription.Notes:
This item comes after Guppy's Collar, Lazarus' Rags, and 1up! in priority.
This item comes before Judas' Shadow, Ankh and Missing Poster in priority.
Picking this up as ??? will set his health to 1 Soul Heart.
 Picking this up as The Lost would not show the number of remaining lives, but will still function.
  The number of remaining lives is shown unless Curse of the Unknown is in effect.
Picking this up as Keeper will reduce his total number of health coins down to one, meaning he will die upon taking any damage. A Health Up Item will restore the lost health coin.
 Picking this up as the The Forgotten has a different effect depending on which form he is in. Picking it up in skeletal form will reduce bone hearts to 1 and will not affect the Soul, while picking it up as the Soul will reduce soul hearts to 1 and will not affect the skeletal form.
Taking Dead Cat through a deal with the Devil while at one heart will still leave Isaac with one heart.
The lives are added after the "picking up an item" animation has ended, so characters that die while the animation is playing will not be revived by this item.
The effects of the D4, D100, Missing No., or 1- or 6-Pip Dice Room will not remove the lives granted by this item.
Deaths do not count towards the statistics if Isaac still has extra lives.
Additional dead cats can be picked up during a run, increasing lives well past 9. Only the first dead cat counts toward becoming Guppy.
Picking up Dead Cat when the player has 0 heart containers and greater than 11 soul hearts can cause the player to go over the normal 12 cap by up to 1 heart temporarily.
 This item counts as 9 items, so if the player is game on trying for an early portal to The Void after beating Mom, this will significantly boost the progress closer to 20 items.
longDescription.Trivia:
The 9 lives gained by the item is a reference to a myth that cats have 9 lives.
The dead cat shares the same tuxedo type bicolor fur with Guppy.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a familiar that will charge across the room, following Isaac's first tear, until it hits a wall and then returns to Isaac to recharge, dealing touch damage to any enemies in its path.
  The familiar deals 3.5 damage per tick or 52.5 damage per second. 
  The familiars attack is affected by momentum, just as tears are. Thus, it can be shot diagonally.
longDescription.Notes:
For Little Chubby to recharge, it must first get back to Isaac. Therefore, running away from Little Chubby after firing it will extend the time required to recharge it.
The enemy Chubber can attack like this item, but they have limited range.
longDescription.Interactions: Duct Tape: Familiar will stay in place relative to Isaac, however, it will still charge across the room but will always return to the spot it first returned to after charging across a room.
longDescription.Trivia: According to Edmund McMillen, Little Chubby is a reference to one of his reoccurring comic book characters and is in fact a talking penis.[1]

longDescription.Effect: Spawns a familiar that drops a coin every 2 rooms.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in PAY TO PLAY (challenge #24).

longDescription.Effect: Spawns a familiar that shoots spectral Technology lasers that deal 3.5 damage each.
Drops a half red heart every two rooms.
longDescription.Notes: There is a very small chance of it spawning from a shopkeeper.
longDescription.Interactions:
???: Useless unless you have also collected Dark Bum, because??? can't pick up red hearts.
Keeper: Will give flies instead of hearts.
longDescription.Trivia:
Little C.H.A.D. will give you a kiss every time you clear a room, even if no half red heart is created.
  A reference to the C.H.A.D. boss from Super Meat Boy, where after defeating C.H.A.D. he becomes very small and in the following cutscene will keep trying to get kisses from Meat Boy.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a small cross that follows Isaac and drops a soul heart every X rooms, where X rotates between:
  3, 4, 5, 4, 4, 1, 4, 4, 5, 4, 5 
  After the sequence is finished, it goes back to position 2 (4, 5, 4, etc.). 
  This is based on the formula: floor(rooms / 1.11) & 3 = 2
longDescription.Trivia: A relic usually consists of remains of a saint or holy person, such as the tooth of Mary Magdalene.[1]

longDescription.Effect: Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac around and fires slowing tears that deal 3.5 damage.

Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac around and fires homing tears that deal 3.5 damage.
 This item belongs to the Conjoined set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a three-faced version of himself.
longDescription.Trivia:
Little Steven originated from the 2009 flash game Time Fcuk, which was created by Edmund McMillen.
In the original Binding of Isaac, Little Steven could only be dropped by Steven, and only 80% of the time.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns an orbital familiar that blocks enemy projectiles and deals 7 damage per tick or 105 damage per second on contact.
Increases the speed of all orbital familiars.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.
longDescription.Notes: The increased orbital speed improves odds of being protected from enemy projectiles.

longDescription.Effect: Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and automatically fires at enemies in its range 3 times per second, dealing 3 damage per shot.
longDescription.Trivia: In the original Binding of Isaac, Demon Baby was unlocked by defeating Satan as Eve.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a blue attack fly orbital that orbits a long distance from Isaac and deals 2 damage per tick or 30 damage per second on contact.
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.Trivia:
This item is used in Challenge #6 (Solar System).
The name of this item is a reference to the Forever Alone meme.

longDescription.Effect:
Isaac is followed by a small bag that drops a bomb every few rooms.
  The bomb dropped can be a normal bomb, 1+1 Free, a Troll Bomb, or a Gold Bomb .
longDescription.Interactions: BFFS!: Familiar is bigger but no effect on bomb drops.

longDescription.Effect:
Bum Friend is a beggar who follows Isaac and picks up coins on the ground. (He does not fill up a familiar "slot".)
After picking up 6 coins, Bum Friend will drop a pickup.
After that, Bum Friend has a 67% chance to drop a pickup after picking up 3 coins and a 33% chance to drop a pickup after picking up 4 coins.
 This item belongs to the Super Bum set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac's bums into Super Bum.
longDescription.Notes:
Bum Friend cannot pick up sticky nickels.
Bum Friend can pick up lucky pennies, but it will simply count as a regular penny and will not grant luck.
From a scoring perspective, pennies that Bum Friend picks up count towards your Schwag bonus on daily runs.

longDescription.Effect: Spawns a familiar that slowly floats diagonally around the room and bounces off walls. The eye blocks enemy shots and deals 8 damage per tick or about 17.1 damage per second to enemies it passes through.
longDescription.Notes:
The empty eye leaves behind a small blood trail. This doesn't affect anything and is a purely cosmetic effect.
The Peeper is distinguishable from the eyes emitted from Peep by the size of the pupil, it being noticeably bigger on The Peeper.

longDescription.Effect: Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac around and fires spectral tears that deal 3.5 damage each.

Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac around and fires two tears at once in a V-pattern which deal 4 damage each.
 This item belongs to the Conjoined set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a three-faced version of himself.
longDescription.Trivia: This item refers to a condition called Harlequin Ichthyosis, which is a rare skin condition from birth, which on babies gives puffy red eyes, green or red crackled/scaly skin, and stretched out lips.

longDescription.Effect: A friendly Daddy Long Legs' shadow follows Isaac and stomps on enemies for 20 damage per tick, with each stomp capable of hitting a single enemy twice for a total of 40 damage. The delay between stomps is approximately 4 seconds.
longDescription.Notes:
The foot stays down for about 1 second, and enemies who wander into it will also take damage.
This item deals enough damage to kill most early enemies in one hit, and is especially powerful against enemies with multiple segments like Larry Jr.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a sideways dagger that orbits Isaac, deals high damage to enemies on contact, and blocks enemy shots.
  The knife deals 15 damage per tick or 225 damage per second.
longDescription.Trivia:
In the original Binding of Isaac, Sacrificial Dagger rotated upright, while in Rebirth it now orbits on its side.
This item is used in Challenge #4 (Darkness Falls).
It deals the highest amount of contact damage out of all orbitals.

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac around and fires tears with random effects similar to other familiars.
The shot types and their damage are:
  Short-range blood tear for 3 damage. 
  Plain red tear for 3.5 damage. 
  V-pattern double shot for 3.5 damage each. 
  Charming purple tear for 3.5 damage. 
  Slowing black tear for 3.5 damage. 
  Spectral tear for 3.5 damage. 
  Long-range homing violet tear for 3.5 damage. 
  Long-range spectral and homing tear for 3.5 damage. 
  Blood tear for 4 damage. 
  Large blood tear for 5 damage.
longDescription.Notes: The type of tear is randomized with each familiar shot.
longDescription.Trivia: This item is used in Challenge #28 (PRIDE DAY!).

longDescription.Effect:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac. If Isaac takes damage, it will shatter and create a blue pool of damaging water, similar to the usable item Lemon Mishap.
  The pool will deal 8 damage per tick to non-flying enemies. 
  After breaking, Holy Water will reappear in the next room.
longDescription.Notes: This item is useless when playing as The Lost as any damage will instantly kill him.
